review_body: Originally I picked this hotel as it was near the airport, with free shuttle service and I wanted a quick place to rest after a long Trans-Pacific flight. I'm so impressed, though I'd stay here again even if I was spending a few days in Honolulu. The staff are fantastic--friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable--nothing fancy, but the price is 1/2 that of a Waikiki hotel. If you just use a hotel to sleep, this will do the trick! Best of all for the budget-minded, The Bus stops right outside the hotel and $5.50 gets you an all-day pass. It's about an hour to central Waikiki, and even shorter the other way to Pearl Harbor. On the downside, not a lot of restaurants nearby you can walk to at night. I didn't expect a lot out of this hotel, but was very pleasantly surprised.

This is a great hotel. It's away from Waikiki traffic and close to the airport. Yes, its close to the freeway so you can hear traffic. What we do to counter the noise is carry our noise makers (got them from amazon for under $50 and they fit in your luggage or backpack). I recommend reserving a bigger room if traveling with several pieces of luggage (we lave lots of luggage because we are usually there on business). If you travel light, the smaller room may suffice. Parking garage is like all other garages, tight. It costs $30/night but cost us $15/night because we are Gold Crown Members. Breakfast is included, usually count on scrambled eggs, oatmeal, rice, mini pancakes, fruit, etc. They alternate between Portuguese sausage and sausage links, with bacon once a week. Also, if you go early, you can usually get right in. If you go with tourists, you may have to wait for a table. But its not usually a long wait. The bed slept good. TV can suck because the signal breaks up on some channels (but most people don't even use the TV while there). Housekeeping is extremely polite and friendly and cater to whatever you may need. Mercy took care of us most of the time (we were in room #805) and she is the BEST!!! The only down fall to our last visit was on our last day. We waited thru 6 elevators before we could get on along with a cart full of luggage. Evidently, as it gets closer to the New Year, it gets more and more crowded. But its all good - we got out without too much delay. We will definitely be staying here again.

When I checked out of my room, I left my Kindle e-reader behind, by mistake. The housekeeping staff turned it in promptly. Originally I had planned to pick it up 3 weeks later when I returned to Honolulu, and they agreed to keep it safe until my return. Because of coronavirus, my plans changed, and I did not stop over in Honolulu. I called the housekeeping manager to explain the change in plans, and she worked with me to send it back safely to me at my home in California. Everyone was very friendly and professional. I'm sure you can imagine how differently this could have turned out. I'm very grateful to the hotel staff and would definitely stay here again.

Honestly, I was not expecting much but the hotel seems to have gotten a nice renovation and the rooms look brand new. While it is still a Best Western, the room looks refreshing and I love the bed. There are both a mini fridge and microwave inside the room. The WIFI (free for Best Western members) also works very well. However, the window remains extremely dirty and they need replacement. I also want to remark on the shuttle service, which was quite good. I was picked up quickly from the airport (although the airport should have better signs), and on my return, they have a shuttle to the airport every thirty minutes twenty four hours a day. I still think they ought to have a better airport hotel in Honolulu but will have no issue coming back to this Best Western in the future if I have a short layover.

Clean and convenient place if you need to be near HNL Airport or Kaiser Permanente. Very quiet. Nice store in the front lobby if you need snacks, toiletries and beverages. Clean room, not cramped for space. A bit expensive to me, but you pay for convenient access to airport I guess.

We have stayed at the Best Western Plaza Hotel twice now, wanting to be near the airport for a morning flight out. The hotel is clean, the rooms are very nice, comfortable beds, and a good breakfast in the morning with a good selection of foods. Staying at the Plaza Hotel enabled me to turn in my rental car the evening before my flight, catch a shuttle back to the hotel, get a good nights sleep, and then good breakfast, before catching another shuttle to the airport for my flight. It beats trying to fight Honolulu traffic early in the morning. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and accommodating.

Kind staff, clean room, free transport to and from airport. BUT, this motel is located in an industrial type area with freeways right beside it. Horrible location. Loud noise from freeways. Nothing nearby for good food and just concrete and buildings and parking yards for surroundings. Really horrible if you expect more than just going to sleep. It’s Hawaii, right? I would not stay here again. Better to pay for a taxi to someplace nice with plants and tropical feel. If you only need a quick airport crash pad, it is suitable, clean, nice staff.

We spent the night here while stopping en route to Australia. It is everything that they advertise here on Trip Advisor. It is nice and close to the airport. The shuttle picked us up about 15 minutes after we called the hotel. There was a good and hot breakfast buffet with real scrambled eggs, fruit, pastry choices, etc. We used regular dinner plates, coffee cups, and metal eating utensils, not plastic, foam, and paper. Although it’s close to the airport, we never really heard airplanes. Ask for a room as far away from the freeway as possible. It is a very busy road. The pool was not in operation, but they offer to take you to their sister property so you can use the pool there. We stayed here before (in July, 2018) and we will probably stay here again.

Our family had an early morning flight and wanted a place near the airport. We thought with a free breakfast and shuttle to the airport this hotel would be a good choice. But unfortunately there were several problems. First, there was no place to park the minivan while we unloaded passengers and luggage, there was only one slot for a compact car. Once inside there was confusion at the desk about the booking being prepaid through a third party service. After that was cleared up, I was given a room key and went to the room. When I unlocked and opened the door, there was a man lying there on the bed. He gave me a surprised look and I apologized and quickly closed the door. The front desk clerk apologized and gave me a different room, but there was no mention of discounting the room or any other accommodation by way of apology. We could not take advantage of the free breakfast because we had to leave at 6:00 a.m., and breakfast wasn't available until 6:30. I would never go back there.

For the price, you'd expect it to be closer to other top brand name hotels and because other hotels are higher priced, most families pick this one. But honestly for $35 more, you get a better hotel, more spacious, more amenities and less dirtier. And don't have to worry about the highway or airport noise that they don't tell you about, just that they are conveniently located, that means were nosier. I would suggest anyone deciding to stay here really look, price other hotels, we had a 7 night stay and checked out after 2 days to go to a different hotel. Not worried about the convenience of being located to an airport if that airport keeps me up at night. Lobby staff was nice, but the room was small, you cannot close the bathroom door without stepping all the way in. Just not spacious and roomy enough for us.

Loved our room, was surprised how nice it was, better than many Hyatt rooms we have been in, and room 1020 is a corner with large windows and amazing views of the Airport and city , no beach but then I see the beach every day, we enjoyed all the lights at night. The airport is right next door but we did not hear a thing.

This has to be the absolute worst hotel I’ve ever encountered at any price . I see from other reviews that the elevator issue is not a new one . The management rationalizes that a part needed to repair the elevator must be obtained from the mainland . Flights arrive on this island continuously with capability to deliver needed repair parts . In this instance the part is apparently being brought over from the mainland on a canoe . The staff makes it sound like the customer is being done a favor by being assigned a room in the courtyard area , be prepared to encounter full blast freeway noise . The room was expensive and had we known how this experience would turn out , there are multitudes of infinitely better places we would have booked . I have a feeling management is constantly on the defensive in these reviews because there is so much to criticize about this horrible place . I really tried hard to find one good thing to write about this establishment but there is absolutely nothing I can compliment .

Really loud road noise- find another hotel! We stayed at this hotel to help facilitate the trip back to Dallas. It was awful. I usually do not write negative reviews!!!Save yourself and your hearing!!!

I stayed here on my return trip with an overnight layover. This hotel is much nicer than the airport hotel down the road and only for $10 more. If you’re trying to decide where to stay, stay here and not there. You won’t regret it.

Arrived on 2/5 only to find out that one of the 2 elevators was down and has been down for the entire time that I was here. Trying to get down to the lobby in the morning especially is terrible, you will literally wait for 20 minutes or more as the elevator not only is trying to pick up people leaving/checking out but also the cleaning teams are trying to get from floor to floor. Sometimes when the elevator finally gets to your floor it is to full to even get on, so you wait again unless you want an aerobic workout doing the stairs. Our room had roaches to greet us upon entering. Parking can be a bit tight if you return to late as there are not enough parking spaces. There is a fairly decent free breakfast each morning and if you join the Best Western club you can get half price on your parking. I would not recommend this location if you want the resort feel as it is located under a freeway under path. 10-15 minutes ride to Waikiki. Pool and gym if interested but truly more of a overnight hotel. If you really want to be close to the airport this is your place, close to all car rentalsCould be good place if you are on a budget, but definitely not a resort vibe

I was in town for a quick business meeting. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. My room was a disaster. It was facing Nimitz and between Nimitz and H1, I might as well been sleeping on the freeway. I realized that this was going to be a problem when the room itself came with two sets of ear plugs. Needless to say, I did not sleep at all that evening and requested to move rooms the next morning. Very disappointed for the price I paid to stay there.

The Best Western is close to the airport. Free shuttle service {pick-up/drop off} The driver duties includes being the bellman. Friendly front desk staff with quick check-in. Hotel is a little dated, but there were some room updates. The room was clean but the bed was low to the floor. The temperature in the room was set very cold,had to ask for a blanket from the front desk. The room was on the 11th floor but not much noise from the aircrafts taking off and landing.Complimentary breakfast is offered for a late check out. The hotel has a sundry in the lobby for to go food items and souvenirs. Please carry a recyclable bag or purchase one. Glass and plastic drinkable items have a 5 cent deposit added. Only fast food eateries are within walking distances.

As other reviewers gave noted, this is the closest hotel to the airport. Don't stay here and expect a resort hotel. We were flying back from Asia, the on to the UA east coast, so used this hotel as a one night stay over.The property is worn but serviceable. Had an 11th floor room and had no issue with noise. My photo shows the rooms to avoid if you do not want freeway noise! Maybe they are cheaper?Rented a car from the airport and returned it before staying over to avoid the parking fee. (Walkable).The breakfast, other than the eggs and coffee, was good. Elavators often took a few minutes and staff was friendly.So if you need a stay over hotel this is suitable. Don't expect a resort setting.

The property is a dated, but what makes this hotel work for travelers is the airport proximity. If you're coming in late, it's a good place to recharge before beginning your travels. Coming in from the US east coast we checked in at 9 PM, but if felt like 2 AM. Having a free shuttle to pick us up and the next day drop us off at the rental car agency was extremely helpful. The breakfast is priced at $18.95 for non-guest, included with say. A good assortment of food items and they offer an "on-the-go" option as well.If you're staying longer, the units around the pool might be a better option.

We stayed at this property one night upon arrival from the mainland. We called the hotel and the shuttle arrived very quickly. We were given a large room on the 12th floor. It was clean and comfortable. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast. Due to an early-morning flight, we were in the queue when the breakfast room opened. The hostess was very nice. The chefs were waiting as the crowd was huge. That being said, we found a table and were able to enjoy a hot breakfast. We used the shuttle to return to the airport. There was a queue just outside the front door. Again, the driver was helpful and the ride back was quick. We would definitely stay here again if we were in transit.

You might as well save your money and sleep in your car under the freeway! Rediculous location under the freeway! No sleep, no rest, NO comfort! Hotel should be torn down--because i can tell that the owner is not going to spend a few million to soundproof it! If they continue to book rooms as is, they should charge like fifty dollars, and let ALL the customers know that this is just a place next to the airport where you can put your luggage in a room, watch tv, snack, BUT NOT SLEEP!

We stayed here overnight during our trans-Pacific layover. Free wheelchair accessible transportation to and from the airport. Breakfast was included. No restaurant for dinner but there are a few places walking distance right around the hotel.

We needed a hotel close to the airport with shuttle service. We were happy with our stay and staff at howl and shuttle were pleasant and helpful. Beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Although adjacent to the highway and airport after awhile you don’t notice the noise. I would stay here again if in the area.

this hotel did not meet our expectations, the key I should have picked up on is the price. however we chose it due to it's location to the airport and the free shuttle. I will never stay there again. the only pluses I already mentioned.Cons: old outdated, dirty carpets, rooms are small, so only 2 (supposed to be double beds) more like twins. these rooms should have a single queen bed only. multiple layers of paint noted. corners dirty, no water pressure, if you turned on the cold water then your shower was cold. if you just used the hot then it was too hot. this hotel acepts pets, it allows pets to use the grass are that is around the pool as a place to do their business!, they provide pick up bags and signs that say pet waste causes disease1 but no enforcement. what a joke. the pool are is loaded with flys! I wonder why. this is a health issue and the Hawaii department of health should take a look at this. I will be notifing them. hepatitis A is a concern. the breakfast items were all cold. do not be fooled. if you don't want to stay in the Wakiki madness stay near Ala Moana. run from this Best Western.

If you don't expect too much you'll be ok for one night. Cleaners keep this place spotless but still very old and carpet has musty smell and building looks like old 1950's motel. I would not stay here if you are in honolulu for more than a day. It coasts around $20-30 to waikiki by Uber for one way and end up coasting more than staying in Waikiki area. If you're flying out next morning yes this place will be fine since they have free shuttle. Several rent car places are walking distance so since we stayed 2 nights we just rented a car for a day and returned it on the same day so we didn't have to pay $30 parking fee. Breakfast is pretty bad but workers were working really hard so we don't run out of food. There was McDonald across from this place and few places to eat. Just for one night you'll be fine.

From the map, it looked like the beach was walking distance, this was not true. After the initial disappointment and renting a car, we enjoyed our time in Oahu - Honolulu.Need mattress toppers and update coffee machines.

Well what can I say myself and husband stayed here for our honeymoon and while it's close to a highway and the airport we found the staff amazing breakfast was yummers and the transport links to the island are just out of this world. We only needed a place to end the day and start the day as we like to go and explore and the staff where amazing and helping us plan things to do.When we wanted to start the day later we went by the pool and relaxed which was nice regardless of the noise, the fact you had places to eat right at the back of the hotel was good as well. If you want a place close to the airport and away from the hustle of waikiki then you should stay here. Each person is treated as a part of their ohana. Mahaloe best Western

Overnight stay as we had an early flight. Arrived early & no problem with storing our luggage while we looked around Waikiki. we walked from the airport - easy 15 minute flat walk. Check in easy. Hotel is very close to freeway & you can hear the cars. I slpet better than I expected, but it may be worth asking for a room away from the freeway. We left to early to have breakfast. Used the shuttle to get to the airport & it was very effecient - leabing every 30 minutes. Would stay again for an overnight

The only good thing about this hotel is it’s efficient shuttle to/from airport. Otherwise be ware that half the hotel is actually a horribly insecure motel with no elevator to second floor. So if you have luggage, do not allow them to put you by the pool on 2nd floor. There are secure gates around this section of the motel, but BW actually props them open so anyone can enter and we saw zero security on premises. I am visibly a sick person who has trouble just walking up stairs and they didn’t warn us, ask if stairs were ok or offer any help on getting to our rooms with no elevator service and we had 2 50-pound suitcases. It was a nightmare, but there are few choices near this airport.

Me and my family was staying in this hotel for one day on December 23, 2019 during our visit to Oahu, Hi. Though we prefer to stay in ocean view room, but, we booked this hotel, because we arrived in Honolulu Airport at about 11 PM and this hotel is very close to Airport and hotel have free Airport shuttle. After arriving and collecting our luggage, we called the hotel and they directed us the location,where we should obtain that shuttle. when we arrived, we found that shuttle was already there (though they informed shuttle would arrive between 5 to 20 minutes). Shuttled driver helped us for lifting and placing our bags in shuttle as well as deporting at hotel. It was about 5 minutes drive from Airport to hotel. At hotel we need to wait for few minutes for check-in but process was very smooth. We got room at 12th floor (heights level of that hotel) and we also want the same. There were 2 elevator in that hotel and as a result we had no problem to reach our room.Room was nice and well decorated. TV with cable, freeze, coffee maker, microwave, free wi-fi and climate control were available in the room. but, in climate control system, they have only scope for cooling the room, but, no scope for heating. For raising temperature inside room, need to stop the climate control system and room temperature will rise naturally. they have one computer and printer in the lobby. Guest can use it and print required documents in black and white free of cost.This hotel provide free hot buffet breakfast from 6 to 10 AM in restaurant adjoining to the hotel. after that this portion use at restaurant for this hotel. Breakfast quality was very good and varieties items were available to it, which were in my opinion better than average. Free shuttle from hotel to airport was also available every half an hour. Guest should inform at least 10 minutes before.They have also car parking facilities but, they charged 430 per day for general guest and $15 per day for Best Western members.Our overall experience of our staying was very good and we recommend this hotel for staying near Honolulu Airport.

You aren’t spoiled for choice at the airport for an overnighter, but as we were away early we needed to be close and this place seemed to fit the bill.The shuttle came really quickly after we called from the airport on the courtesy phone and we were quickly checked in.We were located more on the motel side in 205 which we got to be carrying our cases up two flights of stairs. The room faced the road opposite and to be honest didn’t look in the safest of places.The room itself was fine, decent bed, storage space and bathroom. No safe though which would have been useful.View from the window was into the pool complex. We had a reasonable nights sleep here.The shuttle runs every 30 mins and we were on the 5.30 shuttle. Breakfast is complimentary and starts at 6, so we missed this, however they do a grab and go bag which they hand out from 5.30.... but the shuttle went at 5.30 so we couldn’t get that either. I did ask but the staff were very inflexible with this.There is a small shop in the hotel for groceries, alcohol etc. Overall for what we paid $180 I didn’t think it was great value.The location is good though and for one night it is what it is.HNL could do with some more options though.

We found this hotel on Expedia.ca.Reasonable rates and clean hotel.Very accommodating for late flight from Vancouver Canada with a free shuttle to/from the airport.Helpful and welcoming reception.Excellent buffet included in the morning from 6:30 am. Some hotels charge up to $40.00 each and serve it in the lobby. This hotel has a full on buffet in a restaurant setting with lots of tables and chairs.Great staff and non guests even come there for breakfast and pay it’s so good!Loud if you’re at the pool due to access to main overpass and highway. In our room we didn’t notice. We returned for a late return flight for a reasonable price. They’ll store your luggage too.Uber to cruise terminal the next morning was $12.00Taxi from cruise terminal was $25.00Would stay again. Great for an overnight or late night flight.

I always stay here during my recurrent airline training. The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is that they stopped serving dinner on property and there can sometimes be noise, but I keep coming back. My last stay was quiet. Staff is friendly. They offer a shuttle to the sister property where you can have a sit down meal.

Located close to the airport and served by a 24-hr airport shuttle, this hotel is a good choice for travelers with late arrivals or early departures. The staff were very warm and friendly and did their best to make us feel welcome. Breakfast buffet was tasty and varied with selections running from waffles and pastries to scrambled eggs and sausage links. We had a large corner room on the 11th floor (1105) that felt very spacious. The bed was firm and about average for comfort. The bath was also about average size, but the tub/shower was tiny and old. Unfortunately, the memory that might stay with us the longest is the noise from the Nimitz Fwy., which was right outside the window. The rooms come pre-equipped with earplugs to help address this problem, but this solution won’t work for everyone.

Room was clean . Quite a bit of road noise even on the 10th floor due to elevated highway ( Nimitz Hwy ) right alongside the hotel . Bed comfortable and nice clean bathroom . Breakfast was good with multiple food choices . In keeping with the Islands of Hawaii the price for lodging and for breakfast was rather high . This hotel appeared to be one of the better deals in Honolulu. Free shuttle to the airport was an added plus . Area itself - immediately along and under the Nimitz Highway - does not inspire a person to want to go out and take a walk . Shares the problem as in all of Oahu - homeless and panhandlers everywhere. Can be a bit daunting!

Rooms are adequate and clean. Very quiet for being near the airport. Free Shuttle is an excellent service to and from the airport. Front desk staff are knowledgeable and prepared to provide information and pamphlets for restaurants and local attractions. The surprising highlight of our stay was the free breakfast buffet! James who worked the food area was wonderful! There was Gluten Free bread, reg bread, pastries, real scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, oatmeal, fresh fruit, coffee, and juice. Soy milk, real half and half, and real butter were also available. It was a treat! I have had breakfasts at five star hotels that were not this good! Our gluten free kid could eat without a worry! Thanks for everything!

Roomy and comfy!! Awesome Decor/ Interior!! I will be back again! Reasonable too!! Friendly staff here at the Plaza Hotel!! Cool to walk through by the pool and is pet Friendly too! McDonalds is right next door to get a late nite snack

Was a central location for all we did. Great place to stay,friendly staff, close to Airport, good breakfast. Comfortable and affordable. The only downfall was having to pay to park your car after you already are paying to stay.

Everything about my stay was excellent. I needed a place close to the airport for an early morning departure, and was delighted by the ease afforded by each employee at every step of the way - from the phone call for a pick-up at the airport to check-in, additional services requested at times, to the quick check-out and ride back to the airport. The window even opened for air flow, which was a big plus. The entire staff held an attitude of helpfulness and excellence.

Very good breakfast buffet with fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage and lots more...diamond member so upgraded to a large room (no suites in hotel). Our room was on 7th floor and very quiet. We got a free cot. Hotel hallway and carpet is dated and needs an update but pool area is lovely with lots of palm trees. Great for our needs we arrived late and have a cruise the next day. Staff very friendly and polite!

My friends and I stopped here overnight on the way to a cruise departing from Melbourne. The free shuttle from the airport was easy. Check in for me was fine although my friends who arrived around 10pm had a few problems. I would have given the hotel a better rating if there had been a restaurant on site. However there is a shop that sells snacks and sandwiches. The room was comfortable. We could have used a few more charging outlets. Free breakfast was included and was tasty. The return shuttle driver was very helpful. It leaves every half hour.

We stopped here on our way from Australia to mainland USA. This hotel is close to the airport. We called the hotel on the courtesy phone near the exit of international arrivals. Driver was helpful and pleasant. Check in was early which was greatly appreciated after a long flying day. We were allocated a room on the 10th floor which overlooked the pool and looked towards the direction of the north shore. The room was a standard 2 double beds. The bathroom was small and tight. The area had a few eateries. McDonalds was right next door. I must say that the hotel is close to the highway and is noisy. We did sleep but were woken up by rather loud motorcyclists who obviously like to hear loud tune their bikes make...not my cup of tea! All in all I would say this was a good place for a brief stay.

Stayed here for a night before I left to spend the rest of my vacation in Hawai'i Kai. The airport shuttle was convenient and prompt pick-up when we arrived. Breakfast buffett was great, many options and staff kept items well stocked and fresh. Rooms were comfortable and there is noise due to the hotel being so close to the airport, but that is expected and did not deter us from having a pleasant stay!

The hotel staff were ver gracious. The service was excellent. The room was spacious and clean. The shuttle from the airport to the hotel was quick and timely. The hotel and the room were clean and everything functioned as one would hope for.

I selected this location in regard to proximity to a conference venue. The reception staff was terrific! The room was adequate but there was NO way to adjust the very cold AC unit! The hidden fee charged at at arrival was an unwelcome surprise. $30 parking fee was reduced 50% only by registering for the Rewards Program.

No, not noisy. LOUD!! The freeway is next door which produces massive noise. That, together with a loud airco unit makes it almost impossible to sleep. Outdated room, but with renovated bathroom. Was it really that loud? My apple watch registered over 85dB.

Room old building on BW was renovated and clean. Espl the bathroom. The a/c was weak- but room was very quiet and comfy. Staff was very kind and caring and precise. Everything is spic and span.Food at breakfast buffet was great- and free- what more can you ask for.Wifi also good.

Hotel is older and dated. Staff ties to make up for it and the place is ok. Clean and if you need a quick place by HNL this is it although the value isnot that good. Free shuttle is helpful saved renting a car

The location is truly near the airport. That is the ONLY plus. The entrance to the hotel is sketchy. The rooms facing the highway are not only noisy, but dingy and poorly decorated. The entire hotel looks tired. I did not see the courtyard where the pool is, so I have no comment there. I hope it is nice and clean because I saw kids headed there in the elevator.

We needed a place to crash before flying home and preferred a hotel with airport shuttle service. Although BW is not a 1st choice when we are traveling, only 2 hotels offered an airport shuttle. Pros: Large room, comfortable bed, expansive breakfast included, reasonably priced, shuttle service.Cons: Despite the room size, the bathroom is tiny and I’m not sure you would have enough room to bathe a child. Second, due to its location, the rooms are very noisy so crank up the white noise app on your phone or wear earplugs.Despite the drawbacks, I would stay here again pre-flight but would look elsewhere to use as a base to explore Oahu.

Over the last several years I have made the Best Western brand my hotel of choice when travelling both on business and pleasure as this trip happened to be. My wife and I elected to stay an extra few days in Honolulu after our 11 day cruise. Normally I will check out where the BW location happens to be but did not do it this time (my biggest regret). Since we were using our pts (the price was right) but location was not. The hotel is a great fit for those travelling in from the airport but not so much if you are wanting to be in the downtown or beach areas. Bus ride almost an hour, 'cheap but not so convenient'. Taxi fare $35.00 to $40.00. Hotel is dated, and if you are a light sleeper between the highway traffic and air traffic can be tough to sleep or stay a sleep. Front desk staff great to deal with as are housekeeping. Breakfast is provided but nothing to rave about. Hot and cold items but limited selection. There is free shuttle to and from airport. Hotel does have an outside pool although we didn't use it does look well kept. For those smokers, there is a place outside by the pool. Again, location, location, location!

BW was very convenient, clean, secured and the staff were very professional; from the Front Desk Agents, Room Attendants, Drivers and Kitchen Crew....Mahalo! Keep up the great work; Have a BLESSED day!

My stayed was good at the Best western. Af first the room we stayed was too noisy from the highway. The service desk was so kind and quick to changed our room to a more quiet room. It made our stayed more enjoyable and pleasant.

Comfortable room, bed sheets were surprisingly soft and silky, room was spacious and clean, and breakfast buffet was hot and tasty. They constantly brought out fresh food and tables were quickly cleaned. We were spending less than 24 hours on Oahu and this place was conveniently located super close to the airport and provided us with everything we needed. Would definitely stay again. The added perk is you don't have to pay those ridiculously expensive resort fees!

I stayed with Best Western in Honolulu for a month, and the service was phenomenal. Breakfast was amazing, staff were extremely friendly, and problem resolution were prompt. Highly recommend to those visiting Oahu.

Rooms in the courtyard are expectedly noisy from the highway traffic, but the noise is partially drowned by the air-conditioning unit. Rooms are spacious, although the bathroom has no sink. Front desk staff are helpful. Good enough for an overnight stay near the airport, specially because they have free airport shuttles (use a US sim to contact them once you're in the HNL airport) & free breakfast

The desk staff were friendly and helpful, the pool was good and a good sized room. However, the pillows were uncomfortable, there was poor air conditioning and no locker for valuables. This hotel is very close to airport.

Great experience at the Best Western near the Daniel K. Inouye airport in Honolulu. Ms. Mena and Mr. Dujon provided outstanding service and were very caring and sincere. Rooms were kept very clean and comfortable.Location of the hotel is very central to everything.

My wife and I traveled to Honolulu for a wedding and stayed at this hotel. The hotel is located near the airport. You would think that the hotel being so close to the airport that you would hear the planes come and go, but it was relatively quiet. So that was great. We stayed at this hotel for a week and the staff was awesome. The breakfast in this hotel is one of the best I've had by far. I would not hesitate to book a room at this location.

Stayed at Best Western and for that brand and image I had $170 is high price, but I must tell you, place was a way better than what my expectation was. Property is clean and seem as it was refurbish not so long ago. Still the rate shall be around $100, but I guess market is the king! I did not have breakfast so I cannot say much about that. Driver from shuttle was on time and friendly, check in smooth so what else to add, next time you are to stay around Honolulu airport, there goes your choice.

This Best Western is walking distance to the Honolulu airport, which we did with suitcases, but also has a shuttle service. It is centrally located in Oahu, four miles from Pearl Harbor and has.parking facilities. Their breakfast buffet is well worth the stay and the breakfast “manager” is a five star gentleman!

If you need a hotel close to the airport that offers a free shuttle and a substantial breakfast included in the price, then this is the place to stay. If your looking for a quiet relaxing hotel, this is not the place. Convenience is what this hotel offers. It does have a nice pool, and is walking distance to some fast food places, but it’s close enough to the freeways and surface streets that there is a constant drone of vehicle noise.

The staff was friendly a speedy check in and check out. The rooms were clean. Overall i would highly stay at the hotel again. The employees were very friendly and welcoming. The lobby area was simply but very modern.

I gave this property a 4 on service because of James at the Plaza Cafe and his staff. Having breakfast in the cafe every morning with an amazing host made us want to keep coming back. James shows his aloha to every person that walks in to the cafe and he engages with his guests and pays attention to detail and knows you and the reason for your visit by the time you leave. Security and Housekeeping were amazing and very helpful during our 4 day stay and they were very prompt and friendly. I’m sad to say that front desk for me was a disappointment. I expected to see the Aloha Spirit as they cater to many diversities including locals. I can honestly say that 3 people out of the entire front desk staff during my stay were friendly and very helpful. If I didn’t see those 3 I dreaded going to the front desk. The one name I remember is Rose. She was not helpful nor friendly and just stared at her computer screen while I spoke to her. I greeted her with a smile and hello and she just looked at me as if I was bothering her and asked another girl who was friendly to help me validate my parking ticket, which btw I had to keep validating daily. When at the gate calling for help to let me out seemed like a chore for whoever was on the other side. It was the same thing everyday, you need to pull another ticket and validate at the front desk. Or repeatedly telling me what I’ve already heard and took up time that I needed to be at the hospital instead of wasting on trying to get out of the garage. Other than that and being locked out of my room late at night, we enjoyed our room along with going to the cafe every morning, speaking with the friendly housekeeping staff and security it was great. Mahalo Nui!

This structure is located very close to the airport. They also have a free shuttle that you can call to take you there. We stayed here because we had a very early flight the day after so it was one of the only options. Unfortunately, we could not enjoy the included breakfast because of the early leave.

The freeway noise interferes with sleeping and the spartan conditions of the room were very disappointing. In regards to the freeway noise, Perhaps improved window treatments as well as window replacements would decrease the decibles.

Breakfast is included in the stay. I went down to have this in the morning, but was then told I could not take it back to my room, even though I promised to bring the plate back. Explained I have a phobia about eating in a restaurant - which is a disability, she ignored me. If I had an outward disability this would not have been a problem. I took 2 sausages and wrapped them in a napkin - THAT was my great breakfast from this Best Western. :( Guess if you also have this concern, you will have to bring your own plate.

The staff is very friendly and helpful whom shows the amazing Aloha attitude toward their customers. The room was perfect and to our expectations. Wi-Fi was easy to setup, which made it so convenient.

I stayed here for an impromptu visit. Easy check in... close to the airport airport shuttle... friendly staff!! Didn't get to have breakfast but I may stay here next time! I would recommend this friends.

Close to airport with 24 hr shuttle service, airport signage not good but that is not the hotels fault!Efficient check in and check out.Pity no on site bar or restaurant for dinner Reasonably quiet despite being next to airport and major road

It was a great stay . Food should be update. Almond milk , turkey option for breakfast, egg whites. Centralize to the airport, waikiki and north shore. A Lot of foot traffic . A little noise because of the time different. People are up when other are sleep because everyone is from different part of the

Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: Great location near the airport for late arrivals or early starts for flights. Great service with the free shuttle and lovely friendly staff. Would stay here again.Only down side was the noise of traffic , due to freeway.

We were moving to the Island and were not going to get the house we wanted for weeks. The Best Western The Plaza hotel was a cost affordable option that really delivered. Their Breakfast restaurant was outstanding and stayed open until 10am. All of the staff was the friendliest and you can actually see how extensively they deep clean each room Between guests. Despite being outside Downtown, its location makes it easy to access the airport and avoid a lot of traffic while you're cruising around the island. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Hawaii: this one definitely gets my highest recommendation for cost, comfort, and ease of use!

Rude Staff, Parking arms didn't work, room key didn't work multiple times. Room amenities didn't work including AC and after a week I am still bandaging up some sort of bug bite I got there.Don't stay here if you want to enjoy Hawaii

My husband and I have stayed at this location on several occassions for business purposes as it provides easy access to the airport however we will NOT be staying here on any future trips. We were extremely disappointed with this past trip. First issue, as a rewards member and frequent guest at this hotel, one would assume a higher level of customer service towards returned and loyal guests. Staff at the front desk lack personable skills and do not fit in the hospitality business. It always seemed as if we were a bother to them from their socializing among other staff at the front. Secondly, each reservation were made with specific request for a king size bed and have failed to accommodate this simple request not once, not twice but at EVERY visit. Lastly, the accommodations in the room was below standards. This past visit was tragic as we were without hot water. We were annoyed to come back after a long day to a cold shower. In addition, the TV service on local stations kept freezing the screen or would constantly lose cable signal and disconnect. Needless to say, we are so disappointed with the lack of Aloha Spirit from this hotel and hope they improve their services in all aspects.

James is absolutely amazing. He is very attentive to the guest needs. He is friendly and always so pleasant. He is always keeping the dining room area looking nice. He makes my day each day I get breakfast!!! Marci is also very pleasant and greets you as you enter dining area.

Super close to the airport which was perfect since we landed late in the day from the East Coast. Shuttle service available as well which is very convenient. Great breakfast buffet and the staff working breakfast were incredibly hospitable and attendant to every guest. Fast wifi. Clean rooms.

We've stayed here many times as we travel btwn mainland & our homeland of American Samoa many yrs. Soooo convenient & great! Just need more spacious parking stalls. The parking spaces near back street need to be monitored, please. Always full.

Great hotel and staff everyone was so sweet and kind. Especially our house keeping Amalia she was amazing very polite always smiling and attentive. Over all I’d recommend mostly for the customer service! The hotel itself was nice and clean lots of amenities and great breakfast area.

My wife and I spent one day and two nights at the hotel. We chose the hotel for its proximity to airport and Pearl Harbour. We had a very good experience. Greeted by very friendly staff ( this was our experience in all of Hawaii!). We stayed in one of the lower two- storey (furthest from the highway) buildings that surround the pool as many mentioned that highway noise is an issue. Was very quiet back here and I would suggest your request a room in this area for the quiet. 10 mins to Pearl Harbour. Many options within walking distance for a casual meal. Good value for Hawaii which is generally expensive.

Seriously overpriced for a seriously outdated hotel. $195 for a hotel room that's brings "redrum" to mind is outrageous. The hallway is a frightening orange. The thermostat is so ancient, I had doubts whether or not it worked. I went there only because I missed my red-eye flight. Its proximity is the spider's web for tired, weary, unsuspecting travelers. MacDonald's and a gas station are your only choices for a hot meal--day or night.

Absolutely loved staying here. Location was perfect as well as amenities. This hotel offered breakfast buffet style absolutely enjoyed the food. Only issue was the toilet gave us issues every other day. They could also invest in comforters the sheet were thin, but other than that nice clean hotel with respectful and polite staff! I'd stay here again!

Located one mile from the airport, rooms have been recently renovated. Restaurants are located within walking distance while full breakfast is included. Staff was friendly and super helpful. On site convenience store had prices comparable with off site locations. There were no interruptions in free WiFi service. There is some freeway noise in rooms facing the highway but otherwise a good stay. Did not get to use the pool.

Mercy is the best room service ever. she always tidy up my room whatever the condition.....like it very muchThe Best Western Plaza is the perfect hotel location for someone who needs to go to the airport.

Mercy is the most courteous room attendant. She is a true representative of Plaza hospitality. Lots of amenities, good location. Close to the airport, downtown and Fort Shafter. Overall the staff here was really friendly.

We stayed here on business trip. I’m very pleased with the house keeping staff. Mine was Ms. Mercy. She was very polite every time we met. She was also very attentive to me and my rooms needs. Thanks!

The Best Western Plaza is the perfect hotel location for someone who needs to go to the airport. A free shuttle service is provided. Breakfast is provided, including a take away option for those leaving before the buffet opens. My room was quiet even though it faced the airport. The proximity to the fast food restaurant next door was convenient and an easy walk. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Right next to the airport so its easy to get to. The people and the housekeeping is reliable and exceptional. The included breakfast is always a full breakfast of average quality. The highway is a bit loud, so it might be hard to sleep if you need perfect silence. Parking can be tight to navigate, but thats a side effect of being in Honolulu.

Staff was friendly enough. Rooms are what you would expect of a room with 2 beds, nothing fancy. Caution-it is sooooo loud. They give you ear plugs to help with the noise. Small bathroom, nothing to write home about.

Service was good. Check in process was easy, convenient shuttle to and from airport. Room was clean, breakfast was good and staff was very accommodating and nice. Would recommend it for anyone that needs a hotel close to the airport.

This airport hotel exceeded our expectations. Location is perfect to spend your first night after a late night arrival. Use one of the 2 courtesy phones at baggage belt 24 and call 05 for the free hotel shuttle. It took the shuttle only 3 minutes to arrive. Friendly driver and very nice front desk staff. We got a corner room in the back of the building. It was a large spotless room with a comfortable bed, a mini fridge and microwave. Good wifi. The bathroom is as in most hotels of this kind: nothing special, but it worked well for us. A lot of people have complains about the noise of the highway and the planes. We don’t. Of course one can hear engines now and then, after all it’s an airport hotel, but the noise was not disturbing. We enjoyed the free breakfast with eggs, sausages and much more + good coffee. Alamo is just one block away, so we walked to pick up the rental car the next morning. There are also more car rental companies in the street and Mc Donalds is just around the corner. The hotel has a large covered parking with ample space (1st hour is free). We spent also the last night of our vacation in The Plaza because we had an early flight back. I recommend this hotel for short airport related stays.

We just PCS’d from Fort Riley, KS to Schofield Barracks, HI and decided to stay at Best Western since not only do you accumulate points but they also have the breakfast buffet, accept pets and have very well experience working with members of the Armed Forces who PCS. Les was the military liaison and the main person who I talked too when I booked my trip, he is very knowledgeable when it comes to PCSing and helped me and my husband out a lot with valuable information that we had not known since this is our first time PCSing. I felt that my family and I were good hands staying at The Best Western Plaza Hotel. I had one time put in a suggestion for improvement to our room door since fly's and bugs kept crawling under our door since there was a gap, and literally within the same day of me putting in my suggestion the maintenance man had came to fix it! We had stayed there for 65 days and it was just a overall great experience.

We stayed in this Best Western Hotel three times during the month of July. We used Honolulu as a base for trips to American Samoa and French Polynesia. It is quite close to the Honolulu airport and has a shuttle that runs back and forth to the terminals. The property is convenient but not a luxury property nor is it meant to be. It was perfect for what we wanted for our time in Oahu—close to the airport, reasonably priced, and fairly close to restaurants, coffee shops, gas stations, and tourist destinations. We did have a car and parked it in the hotel lot for which there is an overnight charge. There are a number of busy highways around the hotel, so there is traffic noise. However, it was more of a white noise and did not bother us. You can request a room away from traffic, and the property also does accept requests for morning early check in with an extra charge.

Stayed at BW on our way out transferring from Hawaii back to mainland... Our room, a pet-friendly, family room, was on the backside first floor, so it was rather noisy, especially owing to the rather loud & obnoxious a/c window unit. Aside from that, we found the staff to be super friendly and accommodating, especially our housekeeper who was extra attentive to our cat. The breakfast buffet is generous with fresh fruit and a good selection of brekky items, and James, the server guy, is so friendly and just a happy influence. Also, the hotel is within walking distance to many good eats and the main airport terminal. Overall a nice place to stay.

top notch customer service. good proximity to the airport and my school location. great maid service, Mrs Mercy was very helpful and took care of all room needs. the mini mart staff showed southern style hospitalitiy and were very help full. receiption staff where also superb. great pool and airport shuttle service.

Place was decent. A lot of military staying here for temporary house waiting to be placed. Everyone was friendly the room served its purpose to have a place to lay my head at night. If I would have know how loud it would have been because you’re right on the freeway and a 25 dollar ride away to the beach I would have stayed closer to the water. The only down fall was not for me but seeing a service member checking in and military had them rent a car and to be told it’s $30 a day. That I felt was wrong just because they came out of pocket. I think since they have some kind of deal with the military that needs to be worked with them and not the service members.

The upgrade to a spacious corner room did not help. Room is still quite dated, with e.g. only coffee making not tea and an old style bathroom. Good bed and wifi though.Yes full breakfast included, but in all dimensions limited; next to pancake station only 2-3 hot dishes, few breads, 2 yoghurts and fruits. Definitely not the promised 4 stars.Shuttle good (2 x per hour schedule, plus on call from airport). And a courtesy one expects from an expensive airport hotel, storing your luggage for an additional 2 nights (for our return to Honolulu from Maui), was rejected with 'we have only small storage. We only do this when 2nd stay is also with us. Go use the expensive airport paid storage'.

Chosen for the proximity to the airport for an early morning flight, I would suggest looking elsewhere if you want a good nights sleep. If the noise of the freeway doesn’t keep you up, the air conditioning, which you cannot control, blasts constantly. The fan is controlled by a central system and you can only adjust the temperature. It is seriously like being on a plane, constant white noise. They supply free ear plugs, which is nice, but not a good sign. It is far from restaurants or anyplace heathy to eat. They are surrounded by cheap eats and takeaway places. There is a little shop in the lobby, which is convenient. The staff is friendly. But if you can spend some extra money, I would recommend it.

We were on the 6th floor (I think). The hotel is showing its age but is clean. Dinning facilities on site, although we only had breakfast in the dinning room. Transport accommodation good and staff very willing to help (like when I left my Ipad on the plane and had to work through the system at the airport to retrieve it). Worth the money.

Currently staying at the Best Western Plaza hotel near the airport while house searching as my husband has been stationed here. It is a great location as it is near the highway and has a McDonald's, an Ihop and a Dunkin Donuts just beside it. They also have a shuttle that goes to the airport. The prices of the rooms are reasonable and they offer complimentary hot breakfast every morning. There is a nice pool located outside with plenty of chairs to lounge on and soak up the sun. They have free wifi and have a computer and printer downstairs located in the lobby for guests to use. It has been very convenient as my husband has had to print a few things for work. Our room attendant Mercy has been very kind and helpful. She keeps the room clean and always makes sure we have fresh sheets and towels. And if she sees us in the hallway she always asks if we need anything. Overall our stay here has been pleasant.

We recently did a one night stop over at the Best Western Plaza Hotel after arriving by plane at 9:30 p.m. The location from the airport was excellent, and easy to find. We did not want to pay higher prices for just a place to sleep and rest up before beginning our adventures. This hotel offered everything we needed for our extended family of 21. The rooms were clean, large, comfortable, and had everything we needed for a great night's sleep. The pool looked nice although we never used it. Free wifi, ample parking, friendly and helpful staff, and a wonderful included buffet breakfast got our vacation in Paradise off to a wonderful start. Plus, theres a McDonalds right beside the hotel for a cheap late night snack.

We stayed at the plaza twice.On our way to Austrilia and on our way back to Denver 2 weeks later.Had a good room and good service both times. They were accomateing to our needs. Recently remodeled pool area and restraunt . Pool was finished.

I'm finally home from my vacation stay in Hawaii. While my family was there we decided to stay a few days at the Best Western Plaza due to location and convenience and of course a good price. I have to say that I do not normally take the time to write reviews eventhough I would like to I just never get around to it. But this is one I wanted to sit down and give a great review. Ok first off right when I got off the plane I found it very easy to take a shuttle to the Hotel. The shuttle service was wonderful picked me up and took us right to the Hotel. The customer service was excellent, every employee was so helpful and friendly. The rooms were so clean and nice. Really it had everything you would expect to have in a hotel room. I was very pleased and felt quite comfortable. The maid was very accommodating and very nice and would clean the room perfectly each day. I will recommend to stay in the highrise part of the hotel and not in the rooms on the outside perimeter. This is just my opinion of course. I did read reviews that said the Hotel noise level is very loud due to the surrounding airport and freeway traffic but I did not find it loud at all. We had a lovely sized room it was big and spacious with 2 beds and nice size closet and bathroom. My favorite part I know it's silly but was there complementary shampoos and conditioners. They smelled so good, very tropical and fruity. I usually bring or buy my own and am quite choosy in what I put in my hair but I loved and looked forward to using these every night. It conditioned my very tangled beached tossed hair which I was at first pretty sceptical. I even took some extra samples with me to our next hotel. Ok so here is the best part of the hotel (even though all the things I mentioned are still great), was the complimentary breakfast. Wow, what a breakfast buffet, each morning was a treat, they have so much food and an amazing variety to offer guest. My family's favorite was the individually fresh made waffles and fresh yogurt parfaits. We had an amazing waiter/ buffet server who greeted us with a friendly aloha every morning and made us yummy parfaits. So if looking for a place to stay keep this one on your list. It was so convenient for parking and right in the middle of Honolulu, close to freeway access and airport. Excellent stay than you Best Western Plaza

Good options for the price. Inclusive breakfast was helpful when traveling with a family of 4. Staff was all around courteous. Hotel was 5 mins or less from airport and car rentals, which helped with early flights. I only wish they offered suite options at this location.

By far the best room attendant that I’ve ever had. She was so sweet & always kept a smile on her face. She made sure that we had new towels and sheets every morning. She kept our room spotless! She’s was outstanding!

We stayed here for one night as we had an early flight the next morning. Location and the shuttle bus were the reasons we booked. The rooms are great and bathroom too. Service was good. Unfortunately the noise is SO bad that the four of us hardly go a wink of sleep! A very rough night had by all. Thankfully we were only here one night. Anymore and we’d have checked out.Also, as we were taking the 5am shuttle, we couldn’t have breakfast nor a breakfast bag to go as they’re only available from 5:30am. We ordered Pizza delivered via DoorDash for dinner which was a great service and we recommend. Not sure we’d stay again, but the convenience was the winner for us this time.

We had to unexpectedly stop over in Honolulu on our way to Mainland USA and the hotel was very accommodating. We had two inter connecting rooms that were clean. Fridge and microwave came in very handy. The included breakfast was amazing. Also a nice pool area for the kids to burn off some energy.

The location of the resort is perfect Nd convenient .. staffs are awesome .. having breakfast included is icing on a cake .. I’m returning in August with my Ohana for a Family Reunion .. definitely will recommend

We stopped here for one night before flying to Kona. Staff is great as others have said. We stayed on the ninth floor with a room directly overlooking the Nimitz Freeway. Felt like we were in the middle of a parking lot at Disney.

Room service was great. Cleaned daily by name Mercy. She was so friendly and accommodating specially after my surgery. She provided all i need to be comfortable. Front desk was very helpful also.....................................................

Have stayed at this hotel more than 8 times over the years. Close to the airport, and away from the Waikiki traffic! I stay here when working in Hawaii, and having parking, and no traffic to deal with is a big plus for me! The staff is very kind--and for this trip especially Emy from housekeeping. Great job! This time they upgraded me to a corner room (ocean side). Very large and quiet. My wife travels with me, and it is in close proximity of busses and the Navy exchange. It has been remodeled, and they have a real complimentary breakfast in the morning. Planning to go back in November because they are within the Government per diem rates. They also offer shuttle to and from the airport.

We recently moved to Hawaii with the Navy and needed a place to stay while we found housing. Everybody here is amazing. Mercy is the best! So sweet and nice! Front desk is knowledgeable and helpful too!! Would stay again in a heartbeat!

If you need to stay near airport without car, this hotel would be one of the great choice. Breakfast is included but a few choices only. Complimentary shuttle bus to/from airport, 30mins/round. Comfortable stay but old facility. Convenience store at lobby. Small but including everything.如果您需要在沒有車的情況下住在機場附近，這家酒店將是您的絕佳選擇之一。 房價包含早餐，但僅限幾種選擇。 免費穿梭巴士往返機場，30分鐘一班。 舒適的住宿，但舊設施。 大堂便利店。 小但包括一切。

Easy access from the international airport in Honolulu, about 10 mins away, make sure you ring them up after baggage claim for the shuttle pick up service.room is clean.Would like to thank house keeping lady mercy for her exceptional service.it is my first time in Hawaii! she is friendly and gave me good recommendations.

We were literally here just to sleep for one night in between flights so we weren't overly bothered about staying in a luxury hotel, especially given hotel prices in Waikiki. We called the courtesy van upon collecting our bags and it arrived after about 15 minutes and took us to the hotel which was nice and close. Check in was quick and easy so were in our room within minutes. We were on the second floor facing the highway but there isn't an elevator for this part of the hotel so we had to haul a couple of very heavy suitcases up the stairs. The room was comfortable and functional, but the noise from the highway was pretty loud. I wouldn't normally be pleased about a loud airconditioner, but the noise from the A/C helped to drown out the noise from the highway. I did wake through the night a few times due to traffic noise. Aside from the noise and lack of stairs, it was a perfectly OK hotel for a fair price. The complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning was great, had all the basics and they were all done well. There is a gift shop/convenience store within the hotel which was handy for picking up some last minute souvenirs. The courtesy van runs every 30 minutes (on the hour and half hour) back to the airport so that made it easy to plan our check out time. If you can somehow avoid the rooms facing the highway I'd give this hotel a big thumbs up, especially if you're wanting to stay close to the airport.

First time here. The is older, but looks like it was remodeled. Lots of well lit covered parking. The room was nice, and ours had a nice view of downtown, Diamond Head, and the ocean! One of the best breakfasts of all the Best Westerns we have stayed at. The staff was really helpful and friendly. All in all, a great place to stay!

The wonderful folks who work at the hotel are great. They are professional, conscientious, and caring. My room attendant was Ms. Amalia. She is incredible. She stays on a schedule and makes you feel welcome when you get to your room.

We stayed one night at the Best Western Plaza to see Pearl Harbor before flying on to Maui. It's very convenient to the airport and the shuttle service was prompt to pick us up. It is also convenient to the Honolulu bus system that got us to Pearl Harbor in no time. The rooms are appropriate for a 3-star. We did not have any issues with interstate traffic noise (our room did not face the interstate) and the breakfast was great. However, the best thing happened when we were leaving....As a complimentary service, the hotel will hold your bags after you check out. We checked-out and visited Pearl Harbor. When we got back to the hotel, we get our bags and started to load into the airport shuttle. That's when my 9 year-old girl realizes she left her travel pillow on her hotel bed...We're tired after the day at Pearl Harbor, the long flight to Hawaii, and the new time zone. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back and my daughter starts crying over a travel pillow :(We ask if was returned to lost and found, but the housekeeping staff had already left for the day. I believe every manager in the hotel then mobilized to find that pillow. Some went to our room to look for it. Others were looking for the key to unlock the housekeeping room where lost/found items are kept. They were frantically trying to locate this travel pillow. By now, we had already held the shuttle up for 15 minutes. I told my daughter we're going to have to leave, but I'm sure they will find it and we can have them ship it to our house. She had tears coming to her eyes, but shook her head okay. Due to the roads at this location, the shuttle turns right and then makes a u-turn to get to the airport. After the u-turn, we're driving by the hotel when I see a manager holding the pillow up in the air and running after the shuttle in his dress shoes and tie. The driver gets on the radio with the manager who says he's getting in his car and will meet us at the airport terminal to deliver us the pillow. The driver unloads our bags but he won't leave. He tells us he's staying here so the manager will see the shuttle and know where we are.Five minutes later, the hotel manager pulls his car over and comes running over with the travel pillow. I try my best to give him a great tip in the middle of the airport drop-off, but he would not take it. He runs back to his car and shouts for me to give it to the driver. Just imagine if every hotel had that kind of dedication to customer service.

I booked through Expedia without paying .Expedia canceled and made a new reservation which I paid for. I arrived at hotel and checked in. Swiped card for incidental charges. Internet did not work despite my asking for help from front desk. Checked out A charge of 233 shows up on my account despite having reservation canceled by Expedia and having email showing reservation canceled. Plaza refused to refund the 233.I will highly against using this hotel .

Great stay for an affordable price. Service was great, excellent and professional staff. Shout out to Ms. Mercy from Housekeeping! She was very helpful and kind. The location of the hotel is close to many if the Honolulu attractions.

Excellent location for seeing Oahu with rental car and proximity to airport, cruise ship terminal, Waikiki. Excellent full hot and cold breakfast options included. Looks tired from the outside, but was very well appointed inside, and had little noise from the airport near by.

Stayed at the Plaza after flying into Honolulu on the way to a cruise. The hotel is close to the airport, next to an elevated section of freeway, in a fairly industrial area. The facility itself was a bit dated, but OK in general. The staff were very nice and accommodating. Complimentary breakfast had a fairly common selection of items and was served in a restaurant on the property. My only complaint is that you couldn't take a tray of food back to your room, had to eat it in the restaurant. Other than that, comfortable stay which allowed us to continue on our way with minimal hassle. We would stay there again when on the way to somewhere else!

I love the pool and the gym. The rooms are clean and kept well every time I return from a long day. I placed a review before, but I forgot to add that the room attendant Mercy is very courteous and professional. She asked me to place a review here on whether or not I liked the service. Good service deserves good praise.

As our flight into HNL was arriving in the late evening, we figured we’d save a few bucks on car rental, parking, and hotel rate (over Waikiki) by staying at The Plaza. Once we landed and picked up our bags, we used the courtesy phones across from carousel 24 to arrange the shuttle. They sent a shuttle right away, which met us at the median across from carousel 20. After the 5 minute ride to the hotel, they greeted us by name and had our room key ready to go. Check-in took 1 minute. We hit the hay and awoke early for breakfast. It was buffet style; not super huge but just enough variety and the food was decent. We took the shuttle (every half hour) back to HNL in the morning to grab our car rental and head into Waikiki. Definitely would recommend The Plaza as pre- or post-Waikiki hotel; not as a base of operations for an entire trip, but definitely a good transition hotel. And all staff were incredibly friendly.

This hotel was perfect for me and my two sons. It was close to Pearl City and Waikiki. Breakfast every morning. Awesome staff. Loved our room housekeeper Mercy. She took great care of us. We didn’t come to Hawaii to stay in our room so this was exactly what we needed at a great price. Would certainly recommend to others.

We opted to stay here because it is close to Pearl Harbor and next to the airport so if you have an early flight like we did this is your place. I did not like that they charge $15 for parking each night even though we are members and $30 without membership. It is out of the crazy zone of downtown and Waikiki so parking should be free here. You can walk to a lot of places including Big Kahuna Pizza. It is right next-door to McDonald’s if that’s your thing. It is tricky to drive in and out of that hotel so good luck with that. The rooms were spacious compared to Honolulu closet standard, but the bathroom was smallish. The place was clean but they needed to wash the terribly dirty windows. The noise was not as bad as I expected; I did not need to wear earplugs. They had the typical Best Western breakfast spread and it was satisfying. Steal cut oats for me and I am good. The breakfast staff was remarkable at keeping food items replenished and cleaning tables so there was always somewhere to sit. All in all this is a good value hotel —drop the parking charges and it would be a great value.

This BW is an older facility. It is busy with families, solo travelers and military. I stayed for about 14 hours on route to Japan. My room was clean and the bed was comfy. My view was westward over the highway and distant mountain. Yes, the highway was loud but I was tired and slept well. The hot water was plentiful for a shower. Breakfast was generous with hot eggs, sausage, waffles, oatmeal, fruit and baked goods. Hotel staff was very kind and upbeat. The convenience store morni g staff was unfortunately unpleasant. The store had nice island delicacies and souvenirs to throw in your suitcase as well as small sandwiches and sushi. Best choice in the HNL area of you are time contrained and do not want the hassle of going into Waikiki. Best for a bed to flop in and a warm breakfast in your belly.

The main pro of this grand 12-storey hotel is its location near the airport despite the noisy and busy traffic of the N Nimitz Highway. This hotel offers a free & efficient 24-hour shuttle: Just call the hotel as soon as you pick up your baggage at the airport.Upon check-in, the hotel charges a deposit of $ 30 on the credit card but remains elusive on the terms of return. In case of dispute, do not hesitate to request the inspection of your room before check-out. Breakfast is included in the price of the room (which is not always the case in the US) but breakfast it is unfortunately not very good: Muffins are not fresh and are the remains of the day before. Yogurts come out from a dispenser and their taste is not good. The common areas of this hotel are ageing old with old carpets. Any guest would expect the worst when entering the room, but once in the room, we are pleasantly surprised because the rooms are clean, spacious, well renovated and the bedding is of good quality. The double window glazing does not provide optimal isolation from the incessant noise traffic of N Nimitz Highway of but makes it more or less bearable. If you have a light sleep, make sure to bring earplugs, The outdoor pool is situated in a very and unpleasant place, since located just under the very noisy North Nimitz Highway bridge. Take also into account that the very intense road traffic around the hotel severely limits walking around the hotel. This hotel to be recommended only for one night.

Hotel is modest and clean. Friendly staff. The buffet breakfast surpassed our expectations. There's a free shuttle to and from the airport, just give them a call once you've picked up your luggage. The hotel is in an industrial area but they did a nice job of making it feel more like a resort.Tip: Request a room opposite from the highway.

Here is where you find people who shine. The staff here is remarkable! Hotels can buy new furnishings but people make a business exceptional. Every single person we passed was kind and brightened our day starting with our personable shuttle driver, Ronel. You couldn't tell he dealt with Honolulu's crazy traffic every day. Ralph at the desk had an easy smile. Maria in housekeeping was bright and cheerful in the morning and James at breakfast greeted every family like Ohana. Breakfast had delicious variety with frequent refills and an assortment of beverages. There was sausage, eggs and waffles (with all the toppings) for me and fresh fruit, yogurt and breads for my wife. Our room had a 180 degree view. It is in an industrial setting to be sure but it did have a distant ocean view and I loved watching planes landing at the airport. With all the windows I expected noise as other reviews noted but the air conditioner's white noise and very comfortable bed gave us a good sleep. I have arthritis and my only problem was the toilet sits too low for me. I managed. We had what I considered a great rate for Honolulu. There is a pool but not a hot tub which would have helped my arthritis but we knew that in advance. Mahalo!

Place was great!!!! Variety of breakfast choices, decent gym to get a workout, not just trend-mills. Our maid (mercy) was the best stayed making our beds, fresh towels and took out all the trash. BEST

We don't normally use Best Western hotels, but opted to stay here for one night in order to be close to the airport.Pros:- Very close to the airport with free 24h shuttle service - Outdoor pool, albeit with a view of the noisy freeway - Comfy beds- Free Wi-FiCons:-- Very dated but clean hotel with a slightly gritty feel- Noisy location under a busy freeway- A long way from Waikiki beach or anything else of interest- Not particularly cheap

Nice staff and pleasant enough room but the noise from the highways outside was horrendous. The rooms are only single glazed, so had to use earplugs to get some sleep. Decent breakfast. Very handy for the airport and a first class shuttle service and driver available.

They never could quite get us the number of towels we needed. Hotel was clean, but nothing special. If all you need is a room, this hotel is ok. Staff was nice and willing to help you. I thought that in Hawaii Best Western would have better accommodations.

I could not have asked for a more pleasant stay. The staff was always friendly and caring. My room was very quite except on the last day when they did some work in the suite next to me and the tree trimmers were working on the grounds outside the windows.

We stayed overnight as we had an early flight the following day. Having dropped the hire car off late afternoon we were looking to enjoy a meal in their restaurant but were informed they don't do dinner, only breakfast. This isn't made clear on the website. However we caught the shuttle provided to the Honolulu hotel that is paired with the BW and enjoyed dinner there. We arrived as it opens at 5pm and it filled very quickly so get there early. The shuttle next day at 5.30am was great and only a 5 min trip to airport. Check in staff helpful. Hotel is clean and bedroom fine for overnight. Would stay there again.

This is a nice hotel. Proximity to the airport came in handy. Staff were good and very helpful. Room was very clean. Parking is very tight and costly. Every so often you would hear the planes during take off or landing.

The hot breakfast was quite good. The dining room was full but the manager worked quickly to find a table for me. I was very disappointed that the pool was closed until noon, which was check out time. I was offered a shuttle ride to a sister hotel's pool but that wasn't very convenient. The hotel is right next to the freeway so there was quite a bit of traffic noise, but I was able to sleep. The TV had poor reception. The location is very unattractive but fine for a one night stay after a long airplane ride.

For business, it is out of the Waikiki crush. Safe and comfortable with a few amenities, even the airport within a short walk. The breakfast was always a highlight of the day and all staff does an outstanding job.

Highly recommend this hotel. Service is impeccable and customer service superb. Hot breakfast make sure you say hi to Kemo he is one special fellow. Front line staff have great customer service skills. Rooms are clean and housekeeping g were very accomdating to our needs.

The staff at this Best Western is hands down the friendliest and most knowledgable that I have ever encountered! Even the housekeep staff was more than happy to offer advice on places to eat and visit for a newcomer like myself. Mercy did an exceptional job of taking care of my every need during my stay and I'm grateful for the aloha spirt that she constantly greeted me with in-passing by the elevators. Thanks so much to you all! I absolutely recommend this location; aside from the friendly staff, it has a central location close to the airport, Pearl Harbor, and the main highway that will easily give you access to anywhere on the island that you would want to go and see!

We stayed in this hotel for awhile due to military move and our experience was great and amazing. No complaints at all.First its near the Airport, everything is accessible, less hustle to deal. The staff are so amazing and very professional. Complimentary Breakfast was great and the staff working there James and Techie were very nice and friendly.. They always made us feel like we’re just home. Thumbs up and great job to these two. Thank you to our room cleaners Ami and Marcy for keeping our room clean and tidy every day. They worked so hard and i admired their dedication to their job. Well done to all the staff in this hotel.

The Plaza Hotel is a high rise hotel conveniently close to the Honolulu airport. It is clearly an older property (probably 50+ years old) and while many finishes have been refreshed, the ambiance remains that of a mid-range 3-star hotel. Check-in was professional and efficient. Although we had reserved a standard king bed room, we were upgraded to a “deluxe” king room (a larger room at the corner of the building). Our room preferences had been noted and honored. That deluxe room was very spacious; the decor was comfortable rather than luxurious. There was a refrigerator, microwave, a small side chair and a desk with an adjustable chair, but no in-room safe. The bed was comfy with a thick, soft mattress pad. Lighting was abundant, as were electrical outlets. Highway noise from the Nimitz Freeway penetrated the single pane windows, however, even though our room was on a back corner of the building relatively far away from the freeway.
