review_body: I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times, and each time, the hotel benefits get worse and worse.The staff is a hardy bunch of friendly people, but I have a feeling this is a case of management cutting the corners for a profit. Out of 4 nights, 3 times we needed the staff to change towels. We are not talking about a spots—some of these towels looked like they were used in a crime scene clean up. Parking prices are just like those in Waikiki, but this hotel is not near Waikiki. They used to have an outside company that provided a shuttle service to the NEX, and that was great because while I was at work, my wife could take in some shopping. Maybe the management should do something like that. If you are looking for a hotel with a friendly staff, and away from Waikiki traffic, this is a moderate hotel with normal Waikiki prices. They used to offer all you can eat crab on Fridays, bar, and dining everyday, but that too Iha’s been cut back.

Would recommend anyone to stay here when you can get something comparable in Waikiki or another neighborhood. If you're just there overnight and want to be close to the airport then it's ideal otherwise would not recommend.

A convenient place to stay (nothing fancy) if you have to stay overnight to change planes at Honolulu airport. Unfortunately I had to wait at least 20 minutes for the shuttle even though I used the special phone in the baggage area and was told it would only be five minutes. I had to go back and make another call and was told the shuttle driver was busy dropping people off and was on his way. Going back to the airport was quick and easy since they don’t have other hotels they need to stop at. Most of the people I saw walking around the hotel were wearing military uniforms since it is near Pearl Harbor rather than close to other tourist sites. It is a very standard older hotel but my room was spacious and the bathroom was clean with a hot shower. The beds were comfortable and the air-conditioning worked great! I was wiped out from an overnight flight and was so grateful they had a clean room for me just after 10 am when the housekeeping staff showed up. Even though the black-out curtains were difficult to arrange and I had to use clothespins to keep them shut, I managed a nap. The planes weren’t too bothersome and there wasn’t a huge amount of street noise despite the nearness of the freeways. The location is very industrial so I can’t say much for the view. My other complaint is the lack of free breakfast and the very limited restaurant hours. The fact that they didn’t even serve dinner the night I was there was a problem for me because there are only a handful of small restaurants close by. My experience with the staff was positive—someone even brought me an extra blanket right away when I called the front desk late at night! There is a local bus route close by that goes to Waikiki Beach but I didn’t take it since the weather was terrible. If you want to save money it is much cheaper than taking a taxi!

We'd booked into the Plaza Hotel as we were returning from Maui and were heading back to Australia the next day. Location and cost wise this seemed like a good choice. Our flight was landing at Waikiki airport at about 11.30am and I'd booked a tour for 1.30pm. We collected our baggage and rang the hotel to request the shuttle bus. We knew it should only take 10 minutes or so to arrive. Half hour later still no shuttle so we rang again. About 10-15 minutes later it arrived. The driver said he'd only received one request, the last one. We arrived at the hotel, asked for a taxi and left our bags to check after we'd returned from our tour. No apology until we checked in later. The hotel's quite nice and we liked our room. Could do better.

Very enjoyable and quiet. The rooms were nice and clean. The cleaning staff, Kat, was very sweet and pleasant to talk to. The restaurant had good food although a little pricey. The facility had laundry right on their property which was helpful as I am out here on business and I only brought so many pieces of clothing.

I stayed at the Best Western/ The Plaza Hotel. I had great service there. Thank you to my room attendant Mercy! She does a great job with cleaning the rooms and has a wonderful cheerful personality each and every day! I really enjoyed my stay there. Thank you!

Opened my window and could see the freeway about 20 feet away. I could hear the noise when I opened the door. Nice view lol. Hotel did move me to another room on the side of the building. Like most places I have stayed in Hawaii for business staff kinda treats you like you should be glad to be here. It was outside of downtown which for me was good because the traffic here is horrible. Parking was $30 per night, a lot of guest park on the street when possible. Fast food is the only nearby option. The hotel restaurant was decent. You might enjoy the pool if you can stand the noise from the freeway right next to you. Don't fall for pics, there's not much to view unless you in a high floor to not look at the surrounding warehouses and businesses.

We stayed at this hotel when we were coming in from Virginia, my husband was assigned to a ship in pearl harbor. Our stay at the hotel was about a month and a half. They helped out a lot with giving us meal vouchers to help with our expenses. The staff is super helpful and friendly. The house keeping lady who took care of was amazing, due to my family's crazy schedule she would let us sleep in and take care of our room later. Amalia always made us feel right at home. Also on Tuesday to Thursday we would go eat at the sister property down the road and they have a super friendly waiter named Tim. We enjoyed when we had on of his tables , he was always friendly and always on top of things. the downfall of this place was the parking. We had a mid sized SUV and they have very limited parking for a bigger sized car.

review_body: This poor excuse of a hotel had one thing going for it - the location right beside the airport. but sadly, it is in dire need of an upgrade and a thorough cleaning.The rooms on the eighth floor seemed above all the noise of street level, until we woke in the morning and noticed cars racing right past our window on the adjacent freeway-hmm

I have never been to Hawaii before and was there for medical reasons. I found it very easy to commute from this location to Tripler AMC when needed. The rooms were extremely clean and the beds made for a great night sleep. The cleaning staff didn't miss a beat and the staff in the lobby were quick to help. I did run into some trouble making my reservations via phone in regards to how I felt I was being spoken to but this was minor. Great place to stay.

We only got a day rate as we fly out at 10pm that night. First thing I notice was the attitude the front desk lady showed the 2 US military personnel that checked in before us. The front desk person was very short and blunt with the officers, and she was the same with me. As I checked in, she called the maid service to inform them to clean our room right at 6:00pm (remember; we were on a day rate). Just a little hint to me that I needed to get out right at 6:00pm. When she found out that I was a Platinum member, her attitude completely changed, offering me to stay longer at no charge, willing to store my luggage while I went for supper. Her change in attitude was offensive, why treat people differently based on status. All in all the rooms are dated, very noisy, the little store was very overpriced, and I didn’t even want to eat in the cafe. The hotel is completely encircled by freeways and right next to the airport. I travel a lot, stayed in a number of Bestwestern Hotels in my travels, this was one of the worst. I was happy to leave the hotel.

Has a 24 hour shuttle to the airport and the rooms are very clean. Our room attendant was Mercy and she did a fabulous job keeping the room very clean and well stocked. Many things are within easy walking distance but a car will be needed to get to the beach. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Honolulu, especially if in the military.

First, if you are military you have to make reservations with the military liaison. This is so they can rip off the government by charging a rate near your TLA limit. When I explained that I would be paying out of my own pocket he gave me a lower rate to include (pet fee, parking and tax). When I checked in the military liaison seemed surprised and confused at the rate he gave me. After explaining myself again he decided to change my rate to exclude pet/parking/taxes costing 16% more. Not having another place for my family to stay I felt trapped and forced to accept the new terms. Upon checking in I learned, the hotel allows a local homeless man with an apparent mental health instability to wander the lobby, courtyard, and mini mart to make purchases. We shortened our stay from 10 nights to one leaving the next day. Changing the terms of our reservation is unacceptable, especially when your family is in the middle of a PCS move. Also allowing the homeless to wander the property freely is a matter of safety for my children. I will not recommend or stay at a Best Western again.

I chose this place because it was by the airport, and we only needed one night until rest of our family got here. The free airport shuttle picked us up quickly. Check in was easy, nice young men at the front desk. The room was on the 12th floor. The hallway walls and carpet looked a bit scary, but the room was very nice and clean. No marks on the walls, carpet looked clean everywhere, furniture looked good ( no dings or scratches). The bathroom was a bit small, but very clean. The bathtub/shower tile grout and caulking were good and clean. And the bath towels were clean, white, and fluffy; not at all worn out. The beds were kind of small (full size), but, hey, there were 2 of them, so we each had a bed! And they were comfortable. Loved the sheets! Since we had the whole evening to find a place to eat, decided to go to Waikiki. So easy to get there and back on the bus which has stops, both ways, right out the front door of the hotel. And cost $2.75/person each way! The most annoying thing about the place was the traffic noise, which I started to notice as I was laying in bed, in the dark, at 5:00AM (my bio clock thought it was 8:00 o’clock because of time difference). But I did not notice it at all the night before when I went to bed at 10:00PM, because my body thought it was 1:00AM and ready to sleep. So if you are looking for something to bug you, the traffic noise could. But not a problem for me. Good place.

Not fancy by any means, and yes, noisy BUT excellent location (especially when your flight gets cancelled at 5 am after 6 hours of waiting) and service is very good. Pool is quite nice and beer sales at the gift shop is a nice surprise!

The hotel is very convenient,nice enough and has everything you need,friendly staff.The room was nice and clean.Good restaurant and Great housekeeping especially (Ms Amalia)Thank you! Safe and secure parking space. We will definitely come back.Highly recommended for military personnel

If you get into the troll kings court up high in the tower it's not so bad, but if you are in the courtyard with the troll peasants the road noise from the overpass will keep you up, every Harley on the island will be sure to rev their engine as they pass on the lower road under the overpass to let you know how loud they can be.

I need to give a big shout out to both mrs Annie and mrs Rowena for being so great and taking care of all our needs. These two have been the best house keepers we could ask for. Been here for nearly 60 days and they both have been so great to me and my family. The rest of the staff from the front desk to the restaurant have all been great I would recommend this hotel to anyone based on the staff...

We stayed here from Feb 14, 2018 until Feb 17, 2018. What can I say the traffic noise was unbelievable. There are three different highways beside, above and further above. My husband who has hearings aids could not sleep because of the noise. The room was clean and adequate, bed was good, shower was hot. They advertise an onsite restaurant but the hours are limited. No dinner service during the week, but you can take a shuttle to another sister restaurant. We did that once meal was okay. We did eat breakfast on site, which was very good. Staff was friendly and pleasant. Out door pool closes at 7:00p.m. no exceptions so therefore if you wanted to be outside in the fresh air you sat at or near the smoking table that was more than full. But the biggest disappointment for us was our rooms were on a second floor addition. Thus the noise problem we faced the freeways and there was no elevator. So staying in Hawaii at various places for 2 weeks we hiked a lot of bags up a full set of stairs. I must say for the price IF we every go to Honolulu we wont stay there.

Let’s sum it up this way - it’s not a tropical vacation resort, but it’s perfect for a quick overnight either on your way through HNL. We overnighted here and caught the early morning flight to the Big Island. Convenient to the airport - convenience shuttle so no need for Uber or rental car. Several restaurants within walking distance. Older hotel, but clean. Mattresses are not the best we’ve slept on, but okay for 1 night.

The Hotel offers great service. We experienced no issues, great housekeeping (Amalia), good food and excellent service from James the waiter and a very helpful from desk. Highly recommended for new Military personnel to the island, very short commute to your new station.

For an overnight stay convenient to the airport, this hotel can’t be beat. Unfortunately, it is located near a busy freeway, with noise all night so good rest is out of the question. Rooms are clean, bath is laughably small, decor outdated, dining so dreary a short walk to McDonalds was the better choice. The room rate is high for the quality so plan on adding a cab or bus fare and go to a better option away from the airport.

I only used this hotel for one night when leaving from our stay on the north shore. It has a shuttle to the airport and most rental car returns are right on that street. So you can check in, return your car, have dinner in their restaurant and take their shuttle to the airport for your early morning flight. Room was clean. Front desk service was fast and courteous. Restaurant was pretty good, and open 6:30 am to 9 pm. This is not a place you would want to spend your vacation. It is right by the noisy freeway and in an industrial area by the airport. There is no parking in front of the hotel for check in. You get one hour free in their parking garage to check in..then they charge $3 an hour or $30 a day to park. There are a few restaurants within walking but not close to anything else

Average room, noisy location next to freeway and industrial section of town. Way over-priced for average accommodations. We chose it because of free airport shuttle. Other Best Western across the country much more pleasing.

This is the closest hotel for in Transit passengers at HNL. You could even walk to this hotel. It has clean rooms and reasonable prices. There is also a McD, BK and iHop next door when you are really hungry.

We had previously stayed 31 days at the Airport Best Western as part of a military move. We had an amazing experience, our room was fantastic and spacious. When moving again we decided to stay at the same hotel, difference being we had a pet now. The pet rooms are incredibly tiny, as a family of 4 our space was limited to say the least. The "pet friendly" rooms are also right next to H1 and the noise kept our cat extremely nervous and jumpy. We were given ear plugs at check in to combat the noise for ourselves. While we made this doable for the week we needed to stay, our biggest issue arose when our bathroom ceiling (which already had obvious patchwork) began pouring water from the ceiling. Water from holes now formed, from our ventilation fan, and from the heating light inside the shower. It was coming from our upstairs neighbor, and when notified maintenenaces solution was to have them turn their tub off. We were told to go about business as nornak and not given an option to move rooms, despite being an obvious electrical and health/air quality issue due to mold. If you are given a typical room in the tower, yes I would recommend this property as a conveniently located hotel, near the airport and BED among other locations.If you are looking for a pet friendly option, I would not put money towards a room here as it was fairly miserable at best.

Location is good for a couple night stay. Must have a car. No place in the area to walk unless your destination is subway or mcdonalds. Good food at the restaurant for breakfast. Reasonable priced items in the on site store.

The bathroom was not cleaned well. The toilet interior parts need repair. There was a hole in the shower area near the spout. We were there because the hotel i pet friendly and we need to get out dog away from the noise of the New Years eve fireworks. We paid a premium price because it was the eve and though we should have at least a decently clean room for the price.

Hubby and I and teen son stayed here prior to an early morning International flight, arriving 6pm and departing 6am the following day, so weren't here for long. Our experience here was less than ideal. Firstly stood around at reception tired and hungry for close to an hour or so while our booking was located....and, just quietly, going into mild panic when being told that they're actually "fully booked" ... booking was eventually found. It appeared to be a problem with booking.com, not the hotel itself.Our room was facing the highway which was a stone's throw away. Ear plugs on the bedside alerted us that we were in for a noisy night....we were so tired that we thought it wouldn't be a problem....it was. The room was immaculately clean & fresh, good amenities provided (including pod coffee machine) Decent sized TV. The beds were on the small side...which along with the noise, contributed to our lack of sleep. The shuttle service was EXCELLENT....from queue outside hotel to airport in under 10 minutes. I would stay here again, but would request a room away from the highway (is too expensive to have a poor night's sleep..) & also pack warmer sleepwear. The air-conditioner was great to somewhat drown out the highway noise, but couldn't be adjusted so it was ridiculously cold overnight for the bedding supplied.

It was true that HNL doesn’t have too many choices of hotel but luckily this choice was a good one.Convenient shuttle from/to the airport and we were upgraded to a corner room with airport view. The room was quite spacious and clean, although the bed was too soft.Uber was available to access to other places such as Waikiki.Breakfast was not included even for elite members but it is order to pay not a buffet.I read the complaints about the noise from the highway but I didn’t notice too much during the night.

We arrived by the 11h20 pm flight. The flight was late. We got our bagages, call the hotel and 10 min. later we had a shuttle just across the bagage claim area. We got to the hotel in no time at all. Nice when your flight is late. The check-in was easy. The room was fine. Nothing fancy but clean. Noisy from the highway but when it is for one night, it is not a problem. It did not stop us at all from sleeping. The next day, we caught the bus (public transportation: 2.75$/person) right across the street from the hotel and in 45 minutes or less we were in Waikiki, on the beach. We would stay there again!

The check in service was quick and efficient. The room was nicely appointed and very clean. We were surprised at how great the restaurant was - food was delicious and service was very good. I would recommend this location to anyone flying in or going to visit Pearl Harbor - close and convenient.

Shuttle service convenient for airport. Friendly and helpful staff. Very comfortable bed. Good internet. Good selection of cable channels. Easy checkout. Good selection in restaurant. Everything necessary available in room
user_name:
Lauren O
Ko Phi Phi Don, Thailand

review_body: Convenient and free shuttle. Clean, pleasant, pool, cafe, nice staff. Close to Pearl Harbor. Stayed one night, spent a Sunday at Pearl Harbor, then drove to our resort in Koolina. Good for a brief stopover. Had rooms at back so not noisy from highway. Joined free as a Best Western member. Cut cost of parking in half to $15. Well worth it.

DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU ARE PCSING TO HAWAII. Total rip off. Taking all of your approved TLA for housing. Place is small and your family will be on top of each other. There is only a mini refrigerator and a microwave. Eating out gets really expensive. It’s hard for a family to survive at this hotel for more than a week.

Our stay at this Best Western was pleasant. The room was clean. The room was next to the freeway so it was very noisy. The staff is always helpful and polite. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Good hotel for airport, staff all friendly, room clean but had odour of stale socks!! Shuttle bus is great feature which goes every 1/2 hour. Awesome view of the freeway. Room was opposite coke vending machine which was noisy.

Got to the hotel too early but this was not a problem for Fran and we sure appreciated that. Fran and Mena were able to accommodate us and we were so glad as we were tired. It is so close to the airport and taking the shuttle was a perfect setup for our plans.

Great value, great customer service and great location. We walked to McDonalds there was a petrol station and a little shopping centre across the road where we had the famous L& L Barbeque for our last night of dinner.Thank you for a great last night in Honolulu and the free 24hr shuttle ride to the airport.

Love the conveniency of being near the airport and the shuttle was great - quite expensive when you check in at 11pm and check out at 6am as you are charged the regular rate for only 7 hours and no breakfast included

After 12 hrs of travel I stayed here for a one night stop before boarding as US Navy Carrier. I got to the desk 10 minutes before 3pm, which is check-in time. I was told the room was not ready and asked to have a seat in the lobby. 30 minutes later I went to the counter to check-in. Finally got my room. Restaurants were close by and I got a good nights sleep. Room did not appear clean. This was the closest hotel to the airport.

Convenient location, on bus line. Near McDonalds and D Donuts. Not a noisy hotel even though it's close to airport. Very helpful staff and clean. Have stayed a few times and always good. Restaurant staff a bit slow but attentive.
user_name:
bob and linda C
Rochester, United States

review_body: The quality is exactly what you pay for. It’s actually decent, but there was a lot of construction going on in the parking and it was limited. My room got skipped several times from the cleaning crew, but overall it wasn’t bad.

What can I say if you have a 1 night layover or need to be near the military bases I highly recommend The Best Western Plaza hotel. Rooms look great recently renovated. Friendly staff and so close to airport and free Wi-Fi. They have free shuttle pickup at airport. Traffic in and out of Waikiki for overnighter just stay here.

Great for views of the airport, room 1018..street parking to the rear of the hotel, pearl harbour 10 mins away in a car, wakiki 15-25 dependent on traffic..easy to get onto major routes, save a few dollars staying here rather than the really high prices downtown

ery close to the airport and Hickam Air Force Base. Close also to restaurants in the strip mall on Nimitz hwy and near by Salt Lake Plaza (2-3 miles). Parking in the base of the tower (No problem if its raining. And it rained several times during my 2 week stay). I stayed for 12 days - housekeeping wouldn't leave enough soap (had to ask for it). The family style rooms near the highway are extremely noisy - I did not see that mentioned when booking. So, maybe due to my fault, did not get a good room at first (had to ask for it) - later gave me a room in the tower (lower noise) that was sub-par - water not draining in the tub. Gift store is well stocked with a nice lady managing it. Front desk guys and ladies were helpful and action oriented. When I requested, they changed my room to the tower where the noise from the nearby highway was lower. Also I am ever grateful to one of the ladies in the front desk who made an excellent travel plan for me to see the island.

I needed a place to spend the night near the airport, so I booked a room for one night. Rate was very reasonable. I called the hotel after I picked up my luggage, and the shuttle was there at my baggage claim within 5 minutes. Staff was nice and check-in process was very quick. My room was on the 12th floor facing the airport and highway. There was no noise from the airport that I could notice, but I did hear the traffic on the highway although it was not loud enough to bother me or keep me from sleeping. Room was very clean with modern bathroom and furniture. Wifi speed was very fast.The hotel has a small convenience shop in the lobby but there are several restaurants and gas station within a block or so. There's also a sidewalk to the airport. The 12th floor had an exercise room and pool outside, but I did not use either. I will stay here again if I need to spend the nigh near Honolulu airport.

In most respects this hotel lives up to what it says on the box. It's very convenient for the airport, and the rates are reasonable for Honolulu (though saying the parking fee is "nominal" when it turns out to be $30 - reduced to $15 for Rewards members - is a bit misleading). The in-room furnishings looked brand new, the wifi worked well, and the staff were helpful. The downsides are the physical structure of the building. We had a room on the 10th floor, and even up there you'll need to use the earplugs (which are provided!) if you're a light sleeper due to the freeway noise. It's also apparently impossible to completely turn off the central air conditioning (a maintenance guy came and could only jam a towel over the outlet) - not a big problem but it was cooler than we'd have chosen during a November visit.

I’m a sailor in the us navy and just pulled in from a deployment. Best western employee Fran help me save 150 dollar by informing of the rewards program and put me in a very nice room fast and efficiently

The hotel was very good. However, "Fran" at the front desk was amazing! She went way beyond what we could reasonably expect to accommodate our special needs. Fran is one in a million. She is the model for what customer service should be.Thank you so much for your consideration and caring.

We arrived late and didn't want to rent a car and then have the task of finding a hotel. So we decided to have the Best Western shuttle pick us up and take us to the hotel for the night. The room was clean and spacious. We had a corner room with a view although a view of nothing special that's for sure. I think they called it an upgrade. lol Check out was a breeze. In the morning we had breakfast which was yummy but nothing special. I think we were really hungry from flying so many hours. In the morning after breakfast we took the shuttle over the the airport to rent our car. The Economy Car Rental picked us up and took us over to the car rental location where we pick up our car... and that's where our adventure of the island began. We would use them again.

Arrived staff wasn’t friendly or welcoming. Our room was outdated. The bathroom was very small the curved shower rod kept the door from opening completely. The room windows seemed to be open no matter how many times I opened and closed the window you could hear the outside in the room. It also was chilli in the room and tried to cut off the A/C and the thermostat didn’t work so we were cold the nights we were there and to top it off $30 a day for guest parking. Won’t be staying here again and will advise family and friends not to stay here

I found the hotel staff to be very professional, knowledgeable and courteous. The room was clean and kept that way my entire stay. The hotel is close to the airport and great for getting to my assignments in the port and not have to deal with the resort traffic by the beach. Advise to get a room away from the freeway though.

We had an early morning flight so chose to stay at the airport. The hotel is a block or two away from the airport with frequent and convenient shuttle service. Our room was clean, well appointed, and larger than I expected. We read a previous review so asked for one away from the Expressway and it was quiet and I slept well. We didn't expect much from the simple restaurant but a simple glass of wine and a well prepared Hawaiian chicken dish was tasty and inexpensive. Not the Ritz (and not Ritz prices) but for an airport hotel it was fine and I would stay there again.

The close proximity to the airport (2 minutes) and the complimentary shuttle make this Best Western Plaza Hotel the most logical choice for me! Friendly, knowledgeable staff, convenience store, pool and spa are all added amenities I plan to take advantage of in the future. Prompt airport pick up is also an added benefit!

Hotel was very clean with comfortable beds. Restaurant served delicious meals. The swimming pool was very clean. Shuttle to the airport was excellent service. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly.

One night stay. checked in late, checked out early. Freeway noise is so loud it is not possible to get a good nights rest. Close to airport, but there must be a better option. Bus driver very helpful and the bus runs on time.

Title tells what you need to know . Fitness center ok. Location close to airport but closer to freeway.. can practically feel vehicles driving by thru the single pane windows. Close to airport and yet awkward to get to if driving. Drive an extra 15 min, get a better value hotel!

great hotel to stay at to visit Pearl Harbor. you do not have beaches or shopping nearby but very easy to reach Pearl and not get mixed up in traffic. You can catch a bus either direction easily so I am told but didn't try A cab is always there out front.

Nothing spectacular about the rooms. Parking stinks and the location I’ds very loud, right under the highway. Also it’s great that they are pet friendly, but the pet area circles the outside of the pool area. When you try to use the pool, you are bombarded with flies. Staff is very nice and very attentive.would I stay at Best Western again, yes. Would I stay at this one in Honolulu, no.

We had stayed here years ago on a one night layover and it was just awful. Dated, dirty and so many broken items in our room.I had read the Plaza had been remodeled so I booked another one night stay for this trip. We got a remodeled room on the 12th floor...delightfully clean and modern.We travel with a sound soother so that covered up the tremendous traffic noise. We loved the convenience of the closeness to the airport.If you can deal with the noise, this hotel is great!

I thought, oh it can't be THAT bad. Yes. It was. I booked a government rate since I'm a federal employee. They put us in a room with a door LITERALLY 5 FEET from the highway. The noise was outrageous! They gave us earplugs, so I slept okay. What was NOT okay? The filthy glass door with long scratches up and down. The rest of the room was okay--not the dirtiest I've been in, but definitely not clean. My son is a germaphobe and refused to sleep under the covers. Would not recommend staying here longer than necessary. Or not at all. Luckily it was only one night. Any longer than that and the roaches likely would've been company.

We stayed one night in order to catch an early flight and found the hotel and restauarnt to be very convenient and a nice end to our vacation. The restaurant, while not fancy, provides a great menu and the food is terrific which is unexpected for an airport hotel. Our waiter James was frendly and efficient. He also made suggestions from the menu. My husband had the Huli Huli Chicken which was outstanding. My hamburger was one of the best I can remember. Location is a little iffy, right under the expressway. Get a room in back to avoid the traffic noise. Would recommend hotel if looking for a place by the airport.

Hotel is very convenient to airport, however it's very loud because it is so close to the highway. So close, in fact, that the hotel gives you complimentary ear plugs with your room. Can't help but think a really good replacement window would help the noise situation. Complimentary shuttle from airport, however the lady at the front desk failed to tell the driver and we waited 30 minutes for the shuttle whose hotel is 4 minutes away after 3 phone calls to the hotel. There is very little surrounding the hotel (restaurants, shops, etc.), however there is a very nice restaurant in the hotel. We ate dinner at the restaurant and we don't know what was best (the service or the food). Food was excellent and so was the service and it was quick as well.

This was a good location for us since we were flying out early the next day after our cruise. It also has a free shuttle to the airport. Fran was so helpful in getting us into our room early with all our bags. She was so friendly & helpful giving us some good advice about the area & when to get to the airport.

Pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Recognizes elite status and late check out, even though i didn't need it. Did Not visit the restaurant or the pool so i can't comment on that. The shuttle was quick and driver was very nice. Not too many places to eat around but i saw a Mcdonalds and a Subway near by. Its a good hotel if you're arriving late to honolulu and dont want to spend a fortune on a missed day at a bigger resort.

My stay at the Best Western was excellent. I do business there very often. Employees were and are very helpful and have always made my stay extremely comfortable. I would recommend this establishment to anyone.

Staff very friendly and helpful. Sharon at reception was terrific at handling an awkward arrival and departure time for us. Rooms are clean and beds very comfortable. Restaurant (breakfast and dinner only) is excellent - great service and excellent food! Location is a 5 minute drive from the airport. Did not experience any airplane noise inside the hotel, but outside on the patio was extremely noisy as the hotel is next to the major freeway. Great hotel for between flight stays.

Stayed at hotel October 2017 prior to very early morning flight. My first impression was that hotel appeared to be much better than negative reviews. Very clean grounds and lobby, very pleasant and (I thought) helpful front desk staff. I asked for a quiet room and was given one away from the freeway side. Room was very clean, comfortable bed and quiet.During check-in I stressed to the receptionist that I MUST HAVE a 6:00 am wake-up call to meet my plane. My travel clock had broken and I have no faith in my ability to set hotel radio/alarm clocks. He repeatedly reassured me that I would receive the call and even showed me that he was writing down my request.Needless to say, no wake-up call. I woke at 6:30, grabbed my luggage and flew downstairs only to be told that the next hotel shuttle to the airport would not leave for another 30 minutes. I told the driver that I did not get my promised wake-up call, I'd already loaded my luggage BY MYSELF into the shuttle and I needed to be taken to the airport now! I guess the driver noticed the smoke coming out of my ears, took pity on me and drove me to the airport.After clearing Agriculture Inspection (long lines), United bag check (long lines), TSA (long lines) and then running through the airport I made it onto the plane as the last to board. The main reason for staying at this hotel is its proximity to the airport, its 24-hour airport shuttle and promise of a wake-up call. Whoever dropped the ball on giving me the promised wake-up call generated this one star rating. Too bad, because I would have been very pleased to give the hotel a 5 star rating.

Stayed one night and was pleasantly surprised at how nice the rooms were. Had breakfast at the restaurant on site and it was good. Staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again. The 24 hour shuttle serve to the Honolulu airport was a plus too!

just a 5 or 10 minute ride from the airport. Excellent free shuttle service. Rooms are older, but clean.Good water pressure even on the 10th floor. Elevators are super slow. Excellent store in the lobby. great selection.

I've stayed at this conveniently located hotel many times over the past few years and I've always been satisfied. ON my most recent stay we got a recently renovated room that was large and comfortable. As always, the staff are very helpful and anxious to meet the needs of guests. Parking is convenient and secure.

They have nice clean rooms available. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a nice place to stay for a night. We stayed here on our last night in Hawaii and it was nice to swim in the pool while we had time to kill before our flight left later on in the evening. It is in a very industrial area and far from the beaches so I would not recommend it as a place to stay if you want to see Hawaii.

we stayed for one night and had an early flight the next day. hotel clean and comfortable. close to airport with free shuttle great for a short stay. restaurant was not open on the night but hotel staff gave information for local takeout

We used this place for a 1 night stopover. They have a free shuttle bus service that runs every half hour, 24hrs a day or you can call from the free phones outside the arrival terminal to get there. It is about a 5-10 minute at tops, either way. The hotel was clean and comfortable and surprisingly we didn't notice any 'airport noise'. The staff were kind and courteous. There was the opportunity to catch a bus into Waikiki for $2.50 each way and a stop right outside the hotel, but we knew we were coming back for longer in a weeks time so we didn't do that. We did walk to a shopping centre (about 40 mins) close to Pearl Harbour (Moanalua Shopping Centre) to go to the AT&T outlet to buy a sim for our phones that gave us unlimited data, text and calls in the USA which proved to be a godsend for our travelling to NYC and back to Hawaii for over 2 weeks. The staff there couldn't have more helpful. We also had lunch tat the shopping village and walked back. The restaurant at the hotel was great. The staff were very engaging and the meals beautiful. The day we departed was so easy because of the location of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I was having a short stopover.

This hotel is dirty and built next to the freeway. The noise from the traffic is loud and continues throughout the night. The fact that earplugs are included in the room should be an indicator to not stay here.

We are relocating to the island and have been staying here long term while waiting for our home! Hotel life isn’t fun, but everyone here at the Best Western has been so great. The front desk staff always have a smile on their face and have been so helpful! Annie was our housekeeper and she was a joy to see everyday! She was always making sure that there was nothing else that we needed and she is so friendly. She remembered mine and my husbands names every time she saw us even if it was just passing us in the hall. She seemed genuinely interested in our life and what we have going on! We want to say thank you for everyone at the Best Western making our stay great so far! :)

With the location of this hotel, traffic noise is the biggest problem. Constant noise from freeway, freeway traffic to airport, and surface street traffic. Location is midway between tourist attractions, close to Joint Base Pearl Harbor Hickam, and Waikiki.

This location was a great start and end point for our daily touring of the Island. Rental car location was within walking distance - one block. Our room was large, clean and quiet. Very friendly, helpful staff. Walking distance to fast food restaurants for quick breakfast/dinner.

The Staff was friendly and the rooms were updated, clean and were pleasant to be in. The lobby and halls were clean and they attempted to update them but the general style made it difficult to really accomplish that.

Needed a hotel close to the Honolulu airport since I had a 7am flight out. The hotel I usually stay in was sold out so I booked here. I hadn't heard great things about it but I didn't have a lot of options. It was a nice surprise-actually a much nicer hotel than where I usually stay! There is no restaurant, FYI, but they have a large shop with lots of food and drink options. My room was nice, clean, quiet. Staff was very professional, shuttle in the morning was quick and easy.

Nice stay. Close to airport. Cleam, small rooms with efficient staff. Overpriced and decor is utilitarian and dated. Would recommend if you've got an early flight to catch otherwise better off staying somewhere closer to town.

Efficient check in and rooms were clean and comfortable. Would stay here again when flight schedules require on overnight stay. Shuttle to/from the airport is nice but took a long time for pick up at the airport. That would be my only recommendation for improvement is to have a more efficient schedule for airport pick up. Prompt schedule to the airport to accommodate early morning flights.

Chose this hotel since it was close to the airport after a late arriving flight. Very convenient. Clean and friendly staff. Liked the pool area the next morning to relax a bit before traveling to our hotel for 8 days. If we had known how close the hotel was to the car rental, we would have taken advantage of the hotel shuttle and then just walked to the car rental place the next day to save us the $15 parking fee. Did not have free breakfast like we are used to at Best Westerns. McDonalds is right next door so we walked there to get the local plate breakfast. Will stay here in the future if we arrive late. Price was reasonable for Honolulu.

My room was clean and comfortable. I was only there for one night as I was connecting to Jetstar the next morning to Australia. I called for shuttle and was told it would be 15 minutes, but it arrived in less than 10 minutes :) 24 hour airport shuttle is great! There is a shop in lobby with a wide selection of snacks and drinks, including a nice selection of wine. There is a delightful hotel restaurant and other options close by. The staff is excellent!!! Friendly and helpful.

This was a great stay. I made the reservation and checked in an hour later. The room was clean and a/c was good! The bathroom was large & bed was comfortable. The Room is spacious also. For a one night stay this was perfect for 2!

We stayed at this best western for one night since it's very conveniently located close to the airport (plus they have a complimentary shuttle service that runs 24hours, just call them using the courtesy phone in the baggage claim area). Very friendly hotel staff that upgraded us to a corner room which was very spacious and clean only the bathroom was a little dated. We didn't use the pool, but it looked well maintained. Breakfast is a little pricey, so we chose to grab a quick bite at Joe's grill express. Would stay here again if we had a layover in Honolulu!

Great hotel as we had a super early flight back to Australia. Loved the shuttle. Rooms were clean and quiet considering the proximity to airport. Seemed to be fairly new. Would be good to have queen size beds instead of doubles as our family of 4 were sharing. Would definitely use this hotel again for an early flight.

The room was very nice and easy accessible. It is very close to the highway and alot of homeless. Close to airport. Not sure if I'd stay again or not. A couple employees are nice but the most part they need to be a little more caring of the guest and hotel needs.

This hotel is very handy for its location if you have an early flight but it's the only hotel I have ever stayed in that gives you free foam ear plugs! I wondered why this was until I realised that our front facing room on the 8th floor was in direct line with an 8 lane elevated freeway! Lorries and motorcycles thundering past at all hours of the night!The room was clean and tidy and well presented, there was a coffee maker, fridge and microwave, toiletries also provided.

Nice, clean and quiet room with a view on 11th floor. 2 Queen-side beds, bar fridge (empty for once), MW, TV - everything OK. ~20 minutes to car return and shuttle to airport.Staff at desk friendly and helpful, you can get your boarding passes printed to save time on check-in. For meals, better drive 5 min to the Moanalua Shopping Center (exit Hotel carpark, Left on Nimitz, drive straight about 1km, turn right at 'Business Center' sign. Ribs at Ruby are good!

A very quiet room in the middle of a lot of traffic noise and an excellent bed made the night perfect after traveling all day. The hotel is somewhat dated but very clean. The restaurant was top notch for breakfast. Would stay there again if I needed to be close to HNL.

So impressed with how amazing the entire staff was provided a wonderful stay. Convenient location and for those looking for a lot of personal attention this is the place the staff was very accommodating and very friendly. All the staff deserve the very Best because that's how they treat us. All the staff makes this hotel outstanding.

RUN far away from this place ! overpriced, Restaurant is HORRIBLE, Rooms are ok but A/C is bad . ( got a upper respiratory infection during my stay) Parking is HORRIBLE. Homeless guy living under bridge frequents the little minimart inside to buy his Booze.

We are both retired Army Soldiers here for out processing at Schofield Army Base. Upon our arrival in Honolulu, we had no hotel accommodations nor car rental. When we drove by Best Western Hotel we were skeptical. To our surprise they quickly offered us a two bed room on the 6th floor. Hotel is Military friendly, rooms are clean, no musty dusty odors. Housekeeping personnel are friendly and great at accommodating their guests' requests! Kudos to Ms. Mercy Beuyuga, she always kept our room clean n promptly provided us with enough coffee, sugar n clean towels! Thank you Mercy! We also liked the multi-level covered parking.Four items of concern:1. Hot water in shower has inconsistent flow. Within 3 minutes of showering the water ran cold like you would have to keep adjusting the flow of the cold n hot water knobs.2. No bar in the hotel. 3. Very slow elevator.4. Employees and staff should have their own "service elevator".Yes, we would come back to this hotel.

The best stay yet. the staff was very professional and welcoming. They all went out of their way to make sure all our needs were met. We usually don't eat at the restaurants but this one, was the best. They had a great variety of food and it all tasted awesome.

We missed our flight, it was around 10 pm and we were searching for a hotel close to the airport. We arranged for their shuttle to pick us up, it arrived within twenty minutes. When I arrived at the hotel the lobby was small and in need of some updating. We entered our room which looked tidy, the bathroom was very small, and the bathtub was dirty. The next morning I spoke with a cleaning lady about it and it was never cleaned. The bed and sheets looked nice and clean. The noise level was high and I had to use ear plugs. There was a charge for breakfast, so we did not eat there. The room was expensive more so than the main hotel we stayed in while there. I would not stay there unless it's for one night.

My family and I left the HNL terminal at 10:00 PM at the end of a travel day that began 18 hours earlier. All we were looking for when we booked our night at Best Western The Plaza Hotel was a quiet, clean room with a comfortable bed that we could access quickly from the airport so we could get a good night’s sleep after a tiring day and before heading to the North Shore. Reviews indicated this was the place and we are very happy with our choice which exceeded every one of our expectations.There was construction at the airport that made it difficult to get to the shuttle pickup spot and we missed the shuttle that was sent for us. The hotel was most accommodating when we called back with our explanation and the shuttle was quickly sent back. The driver was helpful and friendly, providing excellent instructions on how to pick up our rental car the next day and assisting in every way possible. Desk staff were efficient and very quickly we were in our rooms and sleeping off a six-hour time change.Rooms were a decent size, beds were super comfortable, bathrooms were spotless and everything about our rooms was well maintained. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast with excellent service the next morning, took the shuttle back to the airport to get our rental car and were grateful for the very easy connection from the hotel to the parking garage. Checkout was very efficient and everyone – shuttle drivers, desk staff, housekeeping and restaurant staff – provided a great introduction to the Aloha Spirit. A wonderful experience with a hotel that fit our needs to a T.

Ok. Clean & tidy. Did have shower flood & was a bit out of the way for the beach took about 50 mins to get in on the bus. It did have a shuttle pick up from the airport though. Would poss try a different hotel if we went again

Rooms not ready upon arrival. Was never informed of any amenities, wifi wouldn't work. AC had been turned off so it was super stuffy in the room. Mold in bathroom everywhere. Very tight quarters. So loud we couldn't sleep.

Flew into the unknown. Booked a hotel for two nights in Waikiki. We couldn't stand the traffic and parking prices of 30 plus dollars. Called up Mr. Les and BAM! Got my family a nice room with two bed. Super comfy and spacious room. The front desk Fran and Mena was super helpful and military friendly. Truly a military family hotel. Best customer service, prime location to many food eateries. Only down side is no beach front. They have a well kept pool. We will be back again.

Best Western staff were very attentive. The location to the airport and mid way of our events were helpful. We will return again this year, due to their service and location. We first wanted to see if it would fulfill our needs and Best Western did. I would recommend the hotel to family and friends.

Location is minutes from the airport, Pearl Harbor, and the Hickman Joint Military base. The staff was great all around. Pool area nice and clean. Room was clean and they provide daily service. Cafe had good food and delicious coffee. Parking can be tough in the garage if you return late in the day. Get yourself a Best Western points card for discounted parking. The real downfall was the noise. The hotel is situated in between the Honolulu airport and the H1 highway. We were on the top (12th) floor and could easily hear all the traffic on the highway day and night. Luckily my wife brought one of the kids sound machines to drown out the noise. The room never seemed to cool down enough so most nights were considerably warm. However, for us we prefer the temp in the low 70's upper 60's when sleeping so may not be an issue for some.

We check in on the 30th of June and moved out on the 24th of july. The experience at the Best Western was Great. I felt safe and at home . The rooms was clean and up to date. Our room attendant Amalia was Outstanding,Very Courteous , All together Great person. She was very considerate when she would knock and will be told to come back, because of a late sleeper. We occupied two rooms connectors. I will revisit the Best Western because her of Welcoming spirit. I been in hospitality for 20years and she is the kind of associate i employer should appreciate. Please acknowledge her with employee of the month.

Very close to the Airport. I somehow couldn't find it because the rental car gps doesn't work when driving on the bottom part of the double decker highway. A 1 minute drive took us 45 minutes :)The hotel is in a good location on the island. You are here for a short visit and want to drive around anyhow so why pay for luxury?!? I was happy to stay here. It was nice and the pool was better than most Best Westerns. I think for someone who wants to experience Hawaii on a budget then I would recommend this. It's cheap but who cares! It's a good value for the smart traveler!!

This hotel is right next to the airport, and they have a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes, but it's also next to the H1 which means that there is A LOT of street noise! There are only a few restaurants within walking distance, and zero nightlife nearby! The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly.

Contrary to other reviews,the hotel was very quiet. Staff was very courteous. Hotel was close to the airport. Stayed overnight between flights and used their free shuttle service between the airport and hotel.

Nice Place to stay, great Value for Military, This hotel will help with the cost of expenses during a PCS coming to Hawaii. Les the Military liaison will ensure that you don't go over your allotted TQSE/TLA (to include pets) if you look at other hotels you will be spending up to $50 per day for parking and $35 per day per pet. Check this hotel out and call Les.

As usual, the people at a hotel set the stage for the stay. No exception here- front desk, gift shop, and shuttle driver were the ones we interacted with the most & they were excellent- good enough that we bought pizza for the night staff on our last night.Although I was there for work, we had a corner room that was bigger than I expected & the view wasn't bad- we could just barely see over the airport (but this isn't a hotel you'd book for the view anyway). The other thing that mattered most was that the room was quiet- very little noise bleeding from the ceiling or hallway. Even though the airport is 1/4mi away, it will still take 5-10 minutes to get to some of the terminals because they have to basically drive to the end of the airport and enter at the far end- not a big deal, but don't expect to be there in 1-2 minutes.Overall, I'd say that if you need something close to the airport, this is your best choice- a little pricey, but I've stayed at hotels in Oahu that charged just as much for a lot less.I'd definitely stay here again if I have the chance.

I was between work locations and want a place to relax before flying out. Great place. Convenient to work, resturants, sites and best of all. No heavy traffic to deal with going to my favorite location. Sleep on on Saturday until 9. As a left the room the housekeepers greeted me and said she would clean while I was down eating breakfast. Courteous and very efficient staff.

Shiloh, United States

review_body: Fran gave us wonderful service. She is an asset to your company. I would return to your hotel based on her welcoming Aloha spirit. She made our day and stay. Mahalo Fran and Best Western. Submitted by Carlton and Danita Torres of Kohala Hawaii.

Stayed for 1 night after long flight from the UK. You ring the hotel for the free shuttle bus from the luggage claim area, phones are free, located near luggage claim area G5. Walk out of the terminal near H5, go right, follow the road around a small bend, do not cross, that's were all the shuttle buses park. Rooms are comfortable, beds were great. Small shop on ground floor level for drinks snacks etc. We did not use the swimming pool, breakfast was good, started at 6.30. Shuttle back to the airport goes every half hour, be ready 15 minutes before. Driver asks which airline you need, saves a lot of walking. Best bit of the stay was the staff, all very friendly.

Plaza best western is a great hotel. Very convenient and is centrally located near the airport. I love the hotel because of this. The only negative is the freeway is near and if noise bothers you, ask to be placed on other side of hotel. Other than that it's a great hotel. Parking is great, restaurant is great. The overall staff is great.

Hotel is expensive but almost next door to airport. Room was clean. Room had complete "blackout curtains" for daytime sleeper. I've used the Airport Plaza going back to 1987. One thing has changed, the shuttle bus no longer picks guests up in front of the baggage claim sliding entrance-exit door. The shuttle bus driver explained he will get a fine. Now the shuttle bus picks guests in the "Tour Bus Parking lot" in the "Back" of the baggage claim area. To find this area, locate the baggage area restrooms. There is one back door located near the restrooms, use this backdoor to enter the tour bus parking lot.

The two double beds were too small for two adults and one 11 year child. For the price they charge they should waive the rollaway bed charge and not try to charge the $30 fee per night. Hotel seems overpriced based on bed configuration and location (in the middle of the expressway with nothing less than a mile away). Good for travelers that need to spend a night near the airport and do nothing else.

Stayed for one night on our way to Kona. Here are a few nuggets. Don't bother calling for the airport shuttle until you have your bags in hand. They won't come until you're actually ready. Apparently they're not allowed to stop and wait. Also, there crossing guards at the airport with whistles that yell at people that cross outside the designated crosswalks.The shuttle driver was very nice and the ride was only about 5 minutes. The hotel is in sort of an industrial area so not much right around. There is a restaurant on site and the food was fine.The hotel sits right beside H1 and Nimitz Hwy. we had trouble sleeping because of the traffic noise. Might want to ask for a room at the rear of the property.Overall, the hotel met our purpose. Room was clean, staff nice, close to airport, and free shuttle every half hour.

Near 2 Expressways. Not noted in literature, AAA, BW, etc. Traffic heavy & noise level obscene. Single pane windows from another era. Motorcycle & truck traffic. Go elsewhere. Opinion: not a quality BW location. Expensive as well. No value.

We ended up spending 42 days at this hotel when we arrived on the island for a military move. We chose this hotel because it was pet-friendly and the perks for military members i transition was excellent. The grounds and facilities were always very clean, and the staff was phenomenal. While I would have preferred to be on the beach, it would have cost us far more with parking for two cars plus pet fee.

Really needed a hotel to stay at last minute after other reservations fell through, but everywhere else in the area was booked up. On a desperate whim, I went to this Best Western to see if i could get anything. I was able to get a room no problem for 7 nights thanks to Fran(she's amazing!). Nice modern style room, great AC, right down the road from the airport. If I'm ever in Hawaii again, I will definitely be starting (and probably finishing) my hotel search here.

Make sure you bring yourself a meal before you checkin! No restaurant food available. The hotel is dark. stuffy and humid. The ladies at the desk should re-evaluate their career choice in the hotel industry. The location is horrible but at least their is a Mc Donalds next to hotel, not my first choice after traveling several hours.

I didn't think I'd stay or need to stay more then one night. Had I known, for only $100 more, I could have stayed in a condo 1 block from Waikiki Beach. Many others stayed at nicer places next to the beach for cheaper. If you only fly in for a day and fly out - this place is fine.

Standard hotel room, pleasantly clean and the bed comforts was average. We were close to freeway but didn't notice the noise being intrusive. We wanted to be close to the airport, so the freeway access was not an issue. We actually liked our view to the harbor. We were most disappointed about the week closure of the pool with no notice. They should have waived the $30 for the rollaway. Sorry to say the food was awful. Front desk and shuttle driver was friendly.

I'm a local and hate being treated like a tourist. These people are also locals and have to tolerate high expectations from mainland kind people. They are on the front line for your company and deserve to be recognized individually right to the security guard.Curious if there is a BW on the beach though? See you again soon. Randi Lynn Barnum

I want to start by saying my 3 Star rating for this property should not steer you away from staying here. It's common for military families to have an extended stay here as it is the only other location on the island that doesn't require a Statement of Non Availability from the Schofield Inn (for Army folks) Parking is free, where lots of properties require an additional fee. Meal Vouchers are provided to military families that are used at the on location restaurant. The rooms are average, definitely not terrible. What makes this place great is the staff. Always friendly and eager to offer assistance. Ramon in the restaurant is awesome. We still eat there once a month just so we can say hi. It's very close to the airport and if needed an airport shuttle is available.

This is an older property situated next to the freeway as in less than 100 feet away from the freeway. While the rooms appear to have been renovated recently and the condition of the hotel is ok, the whole experience is RUINED by the constant freeway noise. They know they have a problem, but instead of replacing the windows with noise abatement windows during the last renovation, they give you a pair of earplugs.

Hotel did not advise of parking charges and requirement to validate parking ticket. 12 hours of parking cost us $50. Hotel manager did not return my call. Could have stayed at a much nicer hotel when you add in the parking charges

Free and frequent shuttle to/from this hotel, and the clean / large room make this an ideal airport stay over for catching up on sleep after a late arriving flight or for catching an early flight out. I went to Joe Express Grill for breakfast (much cheaper). Only downside is ambient noise from the freeway, generally not too much of an issue apart from the odd noisy car. The hotel would benefit from a upgrade to better double glazing for sound proofing

This hotel offers a free shuttle. It is clean. There is a good restaurant. It is a convenient place to stay if you are coming in a day early for a cruise. It is about a $12 Uber ride to the port. Staff were friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable.

Had problems finding a hotel close to the Us Army hospital, luckily I found this hotel which is only a couple minutes from the airport and about ten minutes from the hospital, will have no problem booking this hotel again.

New York City, New York

review_body: The advantage is it's vicinity of the airport. Look out for the phones at the luggage-belt and call the hotel... the shuttle is commuting every 30 minutes. You will find. Shop and laundry room on the ground floor.

Why would you want to stay in Waikiki on a business trip in all of that chaos when the Best Western is close enough to everything for all your needs? Besides that... The Staff!!! Nothing short of outstanding. From Check in to check out Fran, Lorenzo, Sharon, and Cyn have been amazing and accommodating. My check in time was only 6 min and I was in a recently remodeled room in no time. Parking was ample and restaurants were close and my drive to the military base was super short.  I had a request for something from the on site restaurant while it was closed. It would have been easy to say "come back later" but Fran went out of her way to fulfill my request with a smile. I'm in HI occasionally for business and have the opportunity to stay at a variety of places... The preferred hotel for my trips is The Best Western. Thanks

Stayed over-night at the Plaza Best Western to be near the airport for ease of catching flight to the mainland. Good, restful stay. Late checkout was wonderful and worth the additional price. Staff was great and the rooms were clean and restful.

Colo Spgs, CO, United States

review_body: This hotel is close to the airport and does well for a quick business trip. Friendly service, clean and convenient. Not a vacation destination but served its purpose for a quick in and out. Airport shuttle was quick and easy. Restaurant breakfast servers were very fast and good food.

Has the advantage of being one of ONLY two near-airport hotels at HNL, but definitely showing signs of age and outdated design. Very inferior restaurant. Fumbled my reservation request for room location.

The Aloha Spirit lives within the staff!! Loved everything about our room: comfortable and clean. Great open hours for sundry/gift shop and laundry room. Wish restaurant was open for lunch or stayed open until 1100.

Staff was very friendly and our housekeeper Marci was awesome! A good place to stay near the airport and not too far from attractions. They provide breakfast and dinner. Wish it was possible to have another exit for the parking garage.

Staff at the Best Western Plaza Hotel where very nice and helpful. The maid service was amazing. Mrs. Mercy was a staff member on our floor and was helpful with anything my family needed to make the stay more comfortable. Thank you Mrs. Mercy. Thank you for all the support and help Best Western staff.

This hotel is affordable, but sits next to a busy road, so the traffic noise is always just outside the door. I'm surprised the staff allows anyone to be placed in the room that we were given. Not happy.

We booked this hotel for one night before we had to be at the airport at 6am the next morning with toddlers! It was exactly what we needed, fast check in and out, helpful staff and clean and comfortable room. The 24 hour shuttle bus was brilliant and only a 10 minute drive to the airport.

Given feedback from others regarding hotel costs in Honolulu, my travel buddy had reserved an AirBnB for us. Yikes! It was a pit; too disgusting to describe, BUT the good news was that there was a Best Western nearby (just minutes from the airport) at a price even less than what we were paying for that dump. Happily they had a room for the 2 nights we needed...a fabulous room in fact...on the top (12th) floor with a clear view of Diamond Head. The room was super clean and so comfortable (with mini-fridge and microwave). The onsite restaurant, which sold us our breakfast, has a pretty decent menu. There is a free airport shuttle and a very accommodating staff. We were able to store our bags for most our checkout day while we toured the USS Arizona Memorial site, did some shopping and had lunch before our evening flight. It probably didn't hurt that I'm a member of BW's reward program. Boom!!

We arrived late after a full day of travel. The staff was quick, efficient and very kind. The room was clean and well kept. The breakfast was very delicious. This was a perfect stop over resting place for us.

Very comfortable rooms and very clean rooms. Staff response was very professional and caring. Restaurant breakfast was phenomenal. I recommend the breakfast Denver Omelet. Parking lot prices are high and if you are staying for a longer duration that could be bothersome. Shuttle service to the airport was very prompt and quick.

Location next to airport and shuttle service to the airport are very good. Otherwise the hotel has panoramic views of the H1 freeway, car sale yards or the airport. Noise levels are very high but they do provide complimentary ear plugs. Rooms are OK. Staff are good. The restaurant is OK for breakfast but is only open on weekends for dinner. Even then the food is uninspiring and drinks range very limited. No wine was available. Again, fine if you are transiting to or from the airport.

We had need of a hotel to stay the night in before a hop to Big Island in the morning. This hotel was great for our needs. Staff was friendly and helpful, and were quick to fix a discrepancy in pricing from my booking with Expedia. I appreciated that immensely. We called from the airport and was picked up by a friendly driver about ten minutes later. The hotel itself was less than five minutes away. It is very close to the highway, but we weren't disturbed by noise. White noise from the central heating vent seemed to cover that up. We had a good nights rest. We were a little disappointed that the pool closed so early (sunset), but we were tired from a long flight anyways, and really just needed to get to bed. The room was very clean and tidy, and public areas were tidy as well. My only suggestion for improvement is to switch to queen beds.I wouldn't recommend this hotel for vacationing folks due to distance to the beach, etc, but it is perfect for an overnight before a flight out in the morning. I would definitely book again for the same purpose.

The worst hotel we've ever stayed at. Staff at check in we're so rude. The room was beside the freeway, and so noisy, although they left earplugs fir you. Shambles trying to get on complementary shuttle. Never stay here.

Location beside the airport was terrific, meal at the sister hotel was wonderful, (due to the reno of the dining room). At the front desk, Fran was amazing and accommodated us with an upgrade to a great room for a wonderful quite nights sleep.

A great hotel close to the airport. Free shuttle every 30 minutes to the airport. The staff are very attentive and caring. The restaurant is large and open air to the pool. The pool is great. The rooms are comfortable and safe.

The Best Western near the airport was just what we needed. It was 8-10 minutes from Pearl Harbor which made it easy to get to for our 8:00 a.m. reservation there. And when we went sightseeing, the H1 highway was right beside the hotel. The rooms were clean, the service great, the staff friendly and helpful, and we loved the express checkout. We only slept in the room as we were sightseeing all day the 2 full days we we there. We spent part of a day on Waikiki Beach, but had no interest in staying in that area because of the higher prices and more traffic issues. The Best Western may not be for others, but it worked well for us. On our third day we drove to the Honolulu pier and boarded a ship for a 7 day cruise to 3 other islands, including 4 port stops.

The front desk staff of Fran and Mena were most welcoming after a long (10 hour flight). A great introduction to Hawaii! We were tired and hungry and the staff were so helpful with a highlighted map and directions. Our room was good even if it was near highway noise( earplugs were provided) The room was surprisingly quiet. Shuttle driver was cheerful and prompt! Good value!

I had a late night flight into Honolulu after a day of touring in Maui. For me it did not make a lot of sense to incur the added expense of booking and getting to a hotel in Waikiki this particular late night. This hotel provided the perfect alternative. When I arrived I was able to call the hotel for their shuttle who was already there picking up other passengers which worked out more than perfect for me. No hassle of getting a rental car or paying for parking when it has already been a long and tiring day. The next morning I was able to walk to the rental car agency and get my North Shore adventures started early. Keep in mind the hotel is in the industrial part of the city and there is nothing of interest for a tourist close by. However, the rooms were recently updated and clean and the front desk and shuttle guy extremely courteous and helpful. While I would not base my entire vacation here I would definitely use them for those later night flights where airport convenience is paramount.

Good hotel for the our visit. The motel was convenient for our purpose and allowed us to be comfortable during our stay. The breakfast was excellent with good people to help. We had no problems here. The hotel is used for military people in transit as well.

We arrived early, Fran got our luggage stored and able to accommodate our room needs, Her customer service is an 12 out of 10. Just ask for Fran and she will take care of you needs. She arranged a taxi driver for us and when he would not take us, she talked yo him and away we go.....

Upon arriving at Best Western I was greeted with a warm smile from Fran. even though i was early Fran went out of her way to find me a room and even upgraded my room. She did an outstanding job making me feel welcome and appreciated.

We arrived early. Fran got our luggage safely stored, booked a cab to see Pearl AND went the extra last mile to get us into oir rooms a little early. Not to.mention she is super nice :) Trust me, ask for Fran.

The room was clean and large. The staff was amazing. Being that I would get back late from my day, parking really was scarce or people who parked would take over the next stall. Otherwise, overall all experience was fantastic!

We called and requested a shuttle upon landing. Three phone calls (25 min later), we were finally assured one was on the way (hotel is 1 mi away). Not a lot of noise control - lots of outside noise from interstate. We arrived shortly before 9 pm (half hour later due to shuttle), and the restaurant in the hotel closed at 9 pm. There is no room service, so we were out of luck for dinner after traveling all day.

If you're looking for a decent, reasonably priced (by Honolulu standards) hotel for an overnight or short stay, this is a good place. Just make sure you get a room far away from the highway end of the hotel. The highway end is so noisy that you will not sleep, and they know it is noisy because they even provide ear plugs in the room.
