Merrie Jo A
St Charles Mo

review_body: Stayed here for a few days after returning from Cagayan De Oro Philippines. Nice place with good rates. Will stay here I am sure on our next rip. Lived in Hawaii from 1969 to 1973 and 1975 to 76. Next trip through Hawaii we plan on seeing how much things have changed around Schofield barracks and the like.

We arrived late in the evening from Kona with a early morning departure for the Mainland. We looked for something close, with a shuttle and low cost. We found the Best Western Plaza. Everything seemed worn and dated in the hotel with construction/repair taking place on the restaurant, pool, etc. No worry McDonalds is on the same block on the far side of the hotel. Shuttle service picked us up and returned us to the airport very timely. Good for a short overnight, with the hotel shop being more expansive than you would expect for travel supplies. Hotel lies beside an elevated highway and a ground highway. Ask for a room away from the noise.

Thank you for the wonderful stay. We will definitely like to,stay here again. Food was delicious and your restaurant staff was great! Usingm the shuttle to the airport was very convenient! The room was very clean and spacious!

We were about to board our flight from Honolulu, only to learn that the destination runway was flooded and the flight was delayed by 24 hours. We needed overnight accommodation, but were unfamiliar with the locality. Fortunately a fellow traveller recommended the Best Western - just around the corner and a few minutes drive on the hotel's complimentary shuttle. It proved to be the perfect refuge, comfortable beds, quiet rooms, an on-site convenience store, and a restaurant . The staff was obviously accustomed to stressed out grumpy travellers, and were extremely helpful and obliging As one might expect, the hotel location cannot be described as scenic - it is surrounded by buildings used to service the airport. However, just a short distance away we found a group of inexpensive cafe's and a few other retail outlets. Summing up - a handy location, clean quiet rooms, good staff, and a free shuttle back to the airport to resume the journey.

This hotel is a good value and is in a very good location if you're visiting Pearl Harbor, Hickam Air Base, or Ft. Shafter. It's less expensive than the hotels in Waikiki and you are only minutes away. Bus stops close to hotel and if you're going to Waikiki, then that's your best choice. It's next to H1, so you may need ear plugs (the hotel provides). Has a shop downstairs next to the lobby and a laundry area if you're here for an extended stay.

I been staying at the hotel for 10 days and Ms. Luz has done an amazing job of cleaning the entire room. She always has a smile and is very friendly, she is so nice and respectful and treated my wife and I as family. The hotel is very nice and Ms. Luz just made it better. Thank you for all you do Ms. Luz and for anyone that is thinking of staying at the best western do it because it is worth it.

We docked at the pier from our cruise and needed a place to stay because of a late flight departure. My husband woke up with vertigo so our plans to tour changed. I called the Best Western from the ship and they told me of their day use rooms. Check out time was 6 pm but I asked for an extended checkout. Fran at the desk went out of her was to get us a delayed departure since out flight wasn't until 10:30 pm. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Thank you Fran for all you help

Wonderful place to stay if you want to be near an airport. Fran, at the front desk, was extremely helpful, getting us into rooms very early in the day so we could settle a bit before setting out for the day. I would definitely go back.
user_name:
Kathy T
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Rooms need upgrading. Location is in industrial area next to noisy freeway. Staff is friendly and helpful though, and hotel is kept clean. Several lights in the room did not work. Window air conditioner was noisy. Bed was comfortable.

We booked this hotel as we had an early morning flight and they offered a free airport shuttle. The front rooms are very close to a very noisy freeway, so ask for a room out the back. The rooms are quite large with a fridge and a coffee machine, but it is quite dated but clean and comfortable. We arrived late and left early so did not use the restaurant or other facilities.

Fran was wonderful checking me in. We desired early check in but the rooms were not available. We flew over night from Asia and were tired. She directed us to a shopping mall where we provisioned and then called us when our rooms were ready. Throughout our stay Fran was awesome. She gave advice for meals and great directions for 3 tired travelers that had never been in Hawaii. The restaurant is great for breakfast. The entire staff is wonderful and attentive. Unfortunately the dinner chefs leave much to be desired. I ordered pork chops which were lovely. However the sides at $7 each were terrible. I ordered the 'garlic smashed potatoes'. I received a dozen baby potatoes in grease. When I explained to the waiter that for $7 a side this was not what I expected. He graciously took them back to the kitchen. He returned 1 minute later with the same potatoes with what looked to be someones fist print in them. I guess at the Best Western Hulk Smash potatoes. Again, tonight as I am a glutton for punishment and a lover of pork I ordered the same dish and received the same baby potatoes devoid of salt, pepper, garlic, butter, chives, and even a hint of sour cream. I offered to make the dish for the chef. I asked to have the potatoes reheated, a dollop of butter, salt, pepper, two tablespoons of sour cream, chives and bacon bits but they would not let me make that order. They could not find my credit receipt and so I paid $7 for a container of cold, raw potatoes that were left at the cashier stand. I did not get recompense but did suggest that the chef use the baby potatoes as suppositories. Cashier actually googled 'smashed potatoes' when I pointed out the difference she said, 'Those are regular smashed potatoes, not garlic smashed potatoes. I would not be so upset but the initial knuckle prints in the first batch of 'garlic smashed potatoes' shows an arrogance and distain that does not belong in customer service. I think this is not the Best the West has to offer.

This hotel was perfect for my transfer trip to my cruise. The staff and room was wonderful. It was close to the airport. Free pick up shuttle was great and on time.This hotel has a onsite cafe and a onsite mini store. The hotel is close to a freeway. The noise level may bother some people. However, it is quite at night when it is less traffic. Complimentary internet.

Very old and not so clean. Beds are ridiculously small and bathroom is woeful but the worst thing is the noise from the elevated highway. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. Staff and service is very good though.

Skip down a little for the pointers.I would have given it 5 but I don't want to oversell this place, the hotel is nice the staff are funny and friendly. The only down fall I have to say is the location. I haven't went to the pool but there was people there enjoying it their gym room is pretty nice (12th floor) because they have free weights and not just a machine and treadmills. But the room, so while I was here for a few days I had friends rent a room at the Princess Sheraton in Wakiki and man oh man that room looked like butt compared to the rooms here. The room itself is nice and spacious but I wish the bathrooms were a little bigger. Bottom line. -nice room small bathroom-right by the freeway always hear cars(didn't stop me from sleeping)-Make sure you have uber or Lyft!! To get you where you need to go. (Ex 16$ from here to Wakiki)-explore the local area there are a few food joints around that are pretty greatPs: I had a awesome made, Annie, she told me some great food places to go and nice places to get some souvenirs (that aren't too over priced)

We stayed here because we arrived late, it was close to the airport and we were staying only 2 nights. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable. We stay at Best Western when ever possible because we are always satisfied with the hotel.

Aloha,Was greeted and remembered by first name by my room house keeper, Ms. Amalia, on a daily basis during my stay. Love that personal touch as well as her keeping my room clean, fresh and stocked. She was always cheerful and had a "Good Morning" and "Have a Good Day" greeting and of course, "Is there anything I can get you?" to include remembering my name. I appreciate that when everything in service now days is so "wham bam" without so much as a thank you for your patronage. For a hotel that's not the Ritz or a Hilton, I applaud Ms. Amalia for her graciousness and professionalism. Mahalo!

A most welcome surprise … the place looks really spruced up from my last visit several years ago. The location is bizarre, almost tucked under a freeway with roaring trucks, but inside the hotel all is very nice. Our room was fairly quiet. The hotel is a 10 minute complimentary shuttle ride from the airport, the staff is superb, the rooms spacious and comfortable. We found the room a/c pretty useless, but they brought us a fan and we slept well. There’s even a nice smoking lounge on the 5th floor. The breakfast menu was large and the food delicious. No room service because the hotel restaurant is only open a few nights a week, but their sister property has terrific food, and it’s a very quick walk. I’d recommend this hotel, it was a good value.

This hotel is clean & bed comfortable with a yummy breakfast on offer in dining room I can certainly recommend this hotel to overnight travellers who wish to be at airport next day and they offer a free shuttle service something we did not encounter anywhere else we stayed so a bonus

If you're in Honolulu and not needing to go be a tourist (i.e. making a stopover), this hotel is a pretty good place. A little too expensive IMO but not too bad considering it's in Hawaii. It's convenient to the airport, has an on-demand shuttle, and has a variety of nearby food locations. Local bus service is at the front door to all locations on the island. Breakfast is very good, dinners a little less so, but satisfactory. Staff was very courteous and efficient, rooms clean and comfortable. Not much of a "view" and too close to a noisy expressway were my only 'complaints'.

Chris was very helpful in getting us to where we needed to go and helped us in our stressful situation to get to the right hotel. I would like to thank Meua, Sharon, Zauaida, Teehie, Michael, Marci, Chabdra, Beau, Soledad, for making my stay very comforting. We have 3 kids so things can be quite trying at times and you put my life at ease by reducing the amount of stress I was under. Thank you all for everything. I would recommend everyone to come and stay because you make everyone feel like family. Mahalo the Rivera family

This is the perfect place to stay if you arrive on a late flight or are leaving early. It's also not too far from Pearl Harbor if you want to visit there. The staff were friendly and professional. They gave us a free room upgrade when we stayed there again the night before we left Hawaii. Most of the rooms do not face the highway, so that was not a problem.

We stayed here overnight on our way to New Zealand, but will stay here anytime we are in this area. Yes, the shuttle service is great. And our driver was so friendly and helpful, he even helped us get our luggage in the elevator and into our room. He told us his name and that he would be on duty until 10p if we needed anything. What a gracious man.The front desk staff were so friendly and helpful. I needed a sewing kit (didn't know if those were even made anymore) at check-in, and the lady gave me one after checking it to be sure all items were included. Thoughtful touch.The restaurant breakfast was very good.I don't know why this hotel was not busier; we did not notice any noise that night. The room was perfectly clean and had everything we needed, and then some.

I was amazed how good was this hotel. The breakfast was one of the best I had in Hawaii, The server Techie was a five star server, the best. The shuttle bus drive Lorenzo was amazing and also five star. The housekeeper , Jycie was excellent. Overall I had much much better experience than Hilton Hawaiian Village. I recommend this hotel very highly.

This is an absolutely no-frills room. The hotel is old and noisy, right next to the road. The bed is hard, the furniture is from the 70s or 80s, and the colors are harvest gold and avocado green -- remember that era? I didn't want to put my feet on the carpet, but the bed seemed clean. There is an attic access door in the ceiling and the "closet" has no door. The lobby is no-frills as well, but there is a convenience store inside, which sells drinks and snacks. We couldn't access the WIFI, and had to use the hot-spot on our phone. The air conditioner works fine when turned all the way down, but if you want to adjust the temperature, it's difficult. If you need a room at the airport, this might be your best option, but I'd double-check. Next time, we have decided that a short drive to another hotel is worth it, even for an early morning flight.

I stayed at this hotel near the Honolulu Airport as I had a 6am flight, and was not sure of the traffic situation from Waikiki that early on a Friday morning.While this is an older hotel, I found my room very well kept, comfortable, clean, and well appointed. The air conditioner worked very well. I was on the ninth floor, on the back side of the hotel and had a view of the airport. Many have commented on the noise level but being away from the Nimitz Highway, I heard no traffic noise, and minimal airport noise. Staff were very friendly and airport shuttle was on time. There is a restaurant on site but it is closed a few nights of the week. There is a fairly well stocked store in the lobby with frozen and microwave food if you are stuck. Overall positive stay, and I would stay here again.

This Best Western suited our purposes being close to the airport. The noise of traffic during the night was a bit loud but the bed was comfortable, the room fairly spacious. Our A/C was very noisy the first night and when I reported it, a repair man came within 10 mins to look at it. He unfortunately couldn't fix the noise but when we returned the next day, the A/C had been replaced with a new unit. Very impressive service.

The hotel is conveniently located near Honolulu airport, but also beside the highway. We heard some highway noise at night but it did not disturb our sleep. A short walking distance away were several car rental options. McDonald's is next door--important to us as we arrived late at night after long travel delays & were hungry. The hotel is modern, clean & with all the expected amenities. Front desk staff was very helpful. The drawback for us was location; if it were closer to Waikiki we would have been very happy to make it our home base.

This is a very clean hotel located adjacent to the Honolulu airport. A free shuttle is provided making this very convenient. Our room was very large and well appointed, more than we needed for an over-night stay between flights. It had great block-out curtains and there was no air-traffic noise.Certainly recommend for a night between flights.

The exterior is unprepossessing, but the staff members are friendly and helpful, the rooms are aging but clean and comforable, and the store in the lobby is unusually well stocked with all manner of supplies and foods--probably because the hotel has many extended stay military guests. There is an outdoor pool and a restaurant that opens for breakfasts (good) and splits evenings with the sister hotel's restaurant one block away (also good).I had no issue with loud jet noise from the nearby airport, and had great courtesy van pickup and deliver service from and to the airport.No problems at although I thought the cost was a bit high--probably because there aren't many hotels close to the airport.

I used to stay at Hilton Hawaiian Village before. This was my first time I stayed at Best Western Plaza in Hawaii. I had the best experience staying at this hotel and it is hundred times better than Hilton Hawaiian Village. Five star service with staff Techie and Lorenzo. I recommend Best Western Plaza very highly.

san francisco, United States

review_body: Staff is helpful to assist us on bus route to Waikiki and Pearl Harbour. Room is better than what we expect in view of the customer's rating of this hotel. Disappointed with the airport shuttle service causing us to wait for around an hour.

A very large clean room for an overnight stay when needing to be close to the airport. The free shuttle was very welcome. The room was very large and very clean, but the room was expensive given it is just a bed for a night. You would not stay there for your holiday

The Best Western Hotel is overall the greatest hotels we've stayed in while in Hawaii. The best part of it was having our daily house keeper, I believe her name was Mercy and we were in room 602. This caring individual would just brighten our morning every single day with her welcoming tone of voice when she knocks politely on our door if we needed service, and her caring hospitality that she showed towards us. Her cleaning part of her was also a plus, she made sure nothing dirty was on the lying around. If one thing I would admire about this hotel, it would be meeting Mercy. God bless and thank you Best Western hotel for your ALOHA hospitality. Mahalo.

The folks here are extremely nice and always extremely helpful. I have stayed here at the plaza many times in the last several years approximately 7 months in total. They do a great job of making me feel at home.

So my husband and I have been at this hotel for over 40 days, waiting for our house to open up. While we have been here we have had many different types of experiences both good and bad. But throughout the entire stay the one thing I looked forward too was the housekeeper Amalia coming to our room. She was always smiles and always friendly and helpful and kind. I have three kids and 2, 4 year olds(twins). She always does extra touches like folding their special blankets ect... It helps, being stuck in a 2 tiny rooms with 5 ppl 3 of them being kids makes for some really stressful times and she helped keep at least one aspect of our stay pleasant. I want to send out a huge thank you to Amalia for making our stay pleasant.

This was a very central hotel (I've stayed for 10 day ). You're minutes from everything There's really no downside to this hotel. The restaurant is great, house keeping is wonderful Mercy she is the best, very nice and helpful and responsive. Recommended if you want to stay very central.

Overall a decent hotel with a good locale for my purpose. The staff was consistently excellent, very helpful and friendly. Others have noted the noise due to the proximity to the freeway, although it was noticeable wasn't too distracting. It had free wifi although it requires you to sign in on a daily basis which got a little annoying since we were there for 10 days. The facilities were great and I had few complaints. Overall some good things and some average things about this hotel.

The hotel as well as the resturaunt are amazing. The staff and comforts make an extended stay quite enjoyable. The food is great. They matched our TLA rates and the laundry facility is updated to accommodate card transactions. Tysee our maid was very friendly and personable!

Stayed one night in March 2016 waiting for connecting flight the next day. I would not stay here again. The hotel is old but clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. However the road noise is seriously loud and constant - take good ear plugs and the hotel is handy to the airport but nothing else. Whilst my travel agent booked it for its location (to save taxi or shuttle fares) once we booked in there was nothing to do. We bused into Waikiki and taxied back again. We may as well have stayed in a nicer hotel and got the shuttle. (Budget travelers)

The staff at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel make this property a very good value proposition. I would agree with others that some of the room decor is dated and if you are expecting a modern in-room contained HVAC system, you won't find it here. I stayed with my son on a medically-related visit from Maui to Oahu so I really just needed a place to overnight between my surgery and the follow-up post-surgery appointment. I had previously been at The Plaza Hotel on a prior medically-related visit. On that trip, The Plaza had updated its cable television system and the local channels did not work on the television Staff tried many things to try to get the local channels to display in my room but were unsuccessful. After providing a review of the property that noted my disappointment, I was contacted by Tracey H Kuamo'o, the Guest Services Manager, to apologize that they were not able to address my issue and to respectfully request that I give The Plaza Hotel another chance. I did on this visit and I am happy to report that I was able to watch the local television channels in my room.I would recommend that if you are looking for a good value in a location near the Honolulu International Airport that you strongly consider The Plaza Hotel.

Staying here for over a month while waiting for a house can be a struggle for a family of 4 plus a large dog in a small two bed 2nd floor hotel room. The staff made the stay less stressful by always being kind and courteous. The housekeepers always did an amazing job, especially Sonia who always wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. It is also helpful when you get friendly smiles every morning and night from waiters/waitresses in the restaurant. Even the maintenance staff are super friendly, they come quickly and resolve the issue. The fridge is a bit small for families who have to stay here for more than a couple days, but it's only temporary. Overall, we've been enjoying our stay here at the Best Western the Plaza.

Staff is very helpful and courteous. Housekeeping Rep Ms. Amelia was very polite and wanted to make sure I had everything needed for a comfortable stay. Rooms could use a bluray/dvd player for people staying over 7 nights.

review_body: If I were to rate this hotel on the staff alone it would get a great rating, however, the decor is run down and in dire need of a face lift. Dingy carpets and interior. the parking is minimal. So arrive early. It has a feel of temporary housing, which a local told me is used for our military men when they are new on the island. Shame on the military for making you folks stay here. I would rather stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. It's about the same price. Just no free breakfast. I did not eat the food at the Best Western. After seeing the quality of the rooms I felt I would be best to skip their food. I can not review it since I never saw it.

After a very very stressful week on Oahu for a family emergency, we booked here before leaving back for the mainland. At first we had some issues. The issues were quickly solved by Reid the front office manager. Not only did he empathize with my situation but he went out of his way to fix it. Not only did he move us rooms, he even carried the luggage for my husband and myself. Wow! Wonderful service from management. But honestly the front desk staff need way more customer service training. Maybe it was an off day for them.Ask for a tower room or you may be stuck with an older exterior corridor room. Thanks again Reid. -Ryan and Daniel-

Stayed here until we got ourself a house.Our stay at the hotel was better than the ones i've been at.Had a great time here our houskeeping Annie made our stay even better, made it feel like home. She was so friendly and very helpful to me she gave me suggestions and advice, since it was my first time staying here. She will treat you like a friend like family. I loved my stay here.

Honestly, we were very impressed with this hotel. We rarely choose Best Western and I think I still imagine the Best Westerns of the 1980s. From the shuttle drivers to the front desk to the waiter everyone was very friendly and just seemed to be in great moods. Because we were on our 30th anniversary trip we were upgraded which was unexpected since it was one night and an airport hotel. The hotel restaurant was closing in 15 minutes so the front desk clerk offered to store our bags and pointed us towards a much needed dinner. Our waiter (Ramon, I think) was awesome and did not rush us at all. I had the Chicken Caesar Salad and it was very large and very good. My husband had the fish sandwich and said it was delicious as well. If you need a location near the Honolulu International Airport I highly endorse this one.

Stayed here overnight as no early enough flight from the Big Island in time to connect with an early morning departure from Honolulu the following day. Very dubious after reading reviews, and had no expectations but needs must. Followed advice and requested a high room facing away from the road and was allocated a clean large corner room on the top floor by very friendly and helpful staff. Dated décor but absolutely fine. Noisy aircon however.Good shuttle to and fro from the airport even at 5.00 am.

The hotel is dated and noisy due to a road leading to the airport. If staying ask for a room facing toward the city. The rooms around the pool are very noisy due to the above.The staff especially Cecelia and Mena were most helpful in suggesting the room we got on the trip in and out of HawaiiThey also allowed us to stay later till 6 and beyond as our flied out was at 11:45 pmWe ate in the restaurant most times as there is nothing much around to walk to. The meals where plain and good and also good quantities

Every visit for me includes a few nights at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. The special feeling received from the staff starts from the time that wheels touch the ground at the airport. They always make me feel special and welcomed. Their smiles and personalities will energize me every time. That is important to me having traveled so many miles in 1 year time. I visited Honolulu 9 times in 2015 and stayed at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel every time. The rooms were always comfortable. The food is always to taste and filling. Most of all I feel that the staff members are the highlights of my visits. My plan is to continue interacting with this fine hotel in the future. (Near future)V/RK. Mitchell

An excellent hotel for an overnight stopover on my way to Kauai. The shuttle arrived very promptly, check in was also very quick. The room and bathroom was very clean, the bed was very comfortable. There was some noise from the motorway but ear plugs easily fixed that. Breakfast was very good, the staff were friendly and professional. The shuttle back to the airport was very quick and I really enjoyed my talk with the very pleasant driver. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

All the staff is so friendly. From the ladies at the front desk, to the wait staff at the restaurant, to the ladies in Housekeeping. Annie was the housekeeper in charge of our room. Every time I saw her she was so friendly and welcoming. She would always take a moment to talk to us. I saw her do this to every guest she would see. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We booked this hotel because of it's location at Honolulu International Airport. We stayed only a half day to rest and cleanup between overnight flights from Australia and the US. Although it was pricey for this purpose, as an older couple, we needed the break from the confines of present day Economy airline travel and it was much more cost efficient than Business or First Class airfare.

review_body: Nice room close to airport but difficult to get to. The room was great and there was a washer and dryer off the lobby but we never used it so I do not know the cost. The hotel had MANY military service men , and some families at the hotel. There is a small gift shop off the lobby and a restraint off the lobby but a bit expensive. Somewhat noisy with the Nimitz freeway and Hwy 1 both outside the front door. The Nimitz runs under Hwy 1 do using the GPS from the phone sometimes leads to confusion. Parking costs $30 a day unless you are a BW member and then is $15 per day.

I checked in on 2/21 for a week. sharon, welcomed me in and got me settled early which I appreciated as I was up all night. During the week Sharon and Mena were very helpful. Just a great team and support. Hookipa wonderful. The other staff also were open, friendly and helpful. On my next visit I will return here.

This hotel is located about a 5 minute drive from the airport and about a 15 minute drive to Honolulu. Traffic is terrible so we used the bus a lot and there are stops directly across the street from the hotel. Using the bus made it fairly easy to to get to Pearl Harbor and downtown. The hotel is older and parking is not great. Do not stay on the side facing the freeway, the hotel actually provides you ear plugs for rooms on that side!

Even though I was only present one night, the service was good. I wished I would have had longer to stay but I was on my way to the Philippines and needed a good night's sleep which was provided. Thanks for the good service with the shuttle pick and return to the airport.

I stayed here as part of a military tour. For the price and location, you can't beat it. The Front Desk staff were excellent. Ms. Erlinda, Athena, Cecilia, Rose, and Myrna rocked! The made sure everything was well-coordinated. Their attitudes always put a smile on my face. Also, there was one young lady who was maid there, I never got her name, but I swear she was one of the hardest working people there. My room was always clean to perfection. My only warning or caution is the parking, due to space limitations, is rather tight and so you have to be careful with that. I can say I was one happy satisfied customer. For anyone else in similar and likewise circumstances as myself, I would recommend it highly.

We arrived to a very clean neatly prepared room. I travel often for work and stay at this Best Western more than 20 days per year. Not a 5 star luxury resort but always clean and the staff is great. I book through Les and get my rooms on one or two week notice. The ladies at the front desk act like they have known me my entire life. This trip my wife came and she liked our view from the corner room. She also liked that Solodad kept our room so clean and she was very pleasent and cooperative. First class service!

review_body: I would like to give a shout out to Lan the front desk reception that help me checking in and providing valuable information about TLA while I check in to Joint Base Pearl Harbor. Also to the outstanding work that my house keeper Grace and Mercy that works at the 6th floor, my room is always in excellent condition and they have great personalities, even giving me advice of where to go around the area.

My experience here was awesome. the room was clean and quiet. The service was great from the front desk and room service. Amalia, who was in charge of my room was super nice and always cleaned the room around my schedule.

First I'll say though we did not enjoy our short stay, we were too exhausted from 20 hours of travel to try and have the problems resolved. Also the staff was fine though we had little contact. Just know that this is a very dated and old feeling place Our room was dirty, smelled the windows did not seal and the traffic noise was just ridiculous. The bathroom set up was just awful no spot to put any toiletries the towels were out on the entrance area. Just a very low end hotel in a loud and dirty area of town. But not cheap spent over $200 to stay one night. We wanted to be near the airport for a connecting flight the next morning what a mistake.

Extremely close to the airport, with a great free shuttle service. The staff are extremely helpful, with outstanding customer service.The hotel is very tired and rooms very very noisy from the highway located right in front of the room. They do supply excellent ear plugs that made a huge difference to the noise. Without these, I would of ask for a room move to the back of the hotel due to the excessive loud traffic noise. The room was clean and comfortable enough as well.The hotel is very expensive, but most airport style hotels are. I am a senior manager for a tour and travel agency in Australia and I would recommend this hotel if you require an overnight stay due to your flight structure. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel to stay while you are here on holidays for a week or so. Research a better location, quality of a hotel or get someone to do it for you.

Just wanted to express my appreciation to Lan & Mina on our recent stay at the Best Western Plaza. We needed a place to spend the day waiting for our 11pm flight back to Ohio. They went out of their way to find us a room and made us feel right at home. I wish I could say the same for other places we've stayed thru the years. My Best Western experience is always a good one.

This was only a six hour stay, got in late and checked out early. Cecilia provided great Customer Service to my sister and I. She went way above and beyond her duties. Once again thank you Cecilia for what you did!! Dawn Edmonson

Joey is da bombvery helpful, found credit card, in dining room. Tanks 2 him rtn it to desk. Saw joey in lobby told me my card is @ da desk. Joey is VERY PROMPT in responding to request i ask 4 xtra towels, xtra pillows, xtra blankets. His actions R professional he is fit 4 dis job. Joey shud be recognized for being an xcellant employee. Joey & other of your employees R da best u hired praised is due 4 each one of themBeau @ front desk rtn my creditcard very kind person. Desk personel R friendly 2!!!Mahalo PlentyMaizelette K. Lacar Guest of Joslin M Sales

Decent place if you have been to Hawaii before or are going there for work on base. The location is right by the airport so you will save a lot of time avoiding the downtown traffic. Staff is great (Mercy) did a good job keeping my room tidy. I worked nights while I was there and found it was not overly noisy or crowded. Gym is small but has enough items to do most workouts.Things that could be improved-Parking is tough in a small parking garage (I am glad my rental was a compact car)-restaurant is only open a few days a week for dinner-laundry should have additional washers and dryers

I picked this hotel because it was super close to the airport and had a free shuttle and seemed much less dodgy than some cheaper options. Shuttle service was great! Hotel is a bit tired, but is clean and bed was comfortable. Hotel is a bit noisey - i stayed on pool side of hotel near on-ramps to highways, but earplugs were provided.

This is perfect if you fly in late night and need a place to stay BEFORE you get your rental car or the night before you fly out the next day. Free airport shuttle. Some rental car agencies will pick you up free the next morning...save a full day of car rental fees! Owl rental cars picked us up the next morning and dropped us off at the airport after our days on the island. Perfect. This BW was clean, staff friendly and helpful. No free breakfast and if you arrive late at night the only place close to eat is McD's. No big deal, just the way it is. Good BW. Price may seem high to the mainland BW's but relax, this is Hawaii. Everything is more expensive. Ask for a room several floors up. We had no noise and a partial view of the water.

The beds were comfortable and that is the best I can say. When entering the hotel it did not have a warm feeling and was very out dated and in need of updates. We were disappointed to find that the restaurant was not open for dinner the night of our stay and we were bussed to a sister hotel which was much nicer. Honolulu Motel at the Airport. The food was very average at the best. We were given a continental breakfast which was a cup of coffee or tea with toast and fruit bowl. We ended up eating and then going out for breakfast at McDonalds. I would not at all recommend this hotel even though it was close to the airport and shuttle was provided. Next time I go back to the Vive in Honolulu.

I stayed here overnight during a layover on my way to Australia. I chose it because it is located very close to the airport. The hotel has a high rise building and a motel-like building. My room was in the (dated) motel-like building, with rooms that open up to the outdoors (no hallway like you'd have in a hotel). My room was on the second floor. With no elevator, it was very difficult lugging our large luggage up the stairs. Also, the room faced a parking area that is adjacent to a small city street. I had a difficult time resting in the room for a few reasons. One reason is that, at some point during the night, the a/c stopped blowing cooled air and instead emitted air that was as muggy as the room. Another reason, there was noise coming from the parking area (voices from people) at late hours of the night. Additionally, the water in the toilet kept running (the kind of sound you'd hear right after flushing when the water level is getting back to normal). At one point (say at about 4 am), I began counting the number of minutes between the quiet and a new round of water noise--- not more than 10 minutes apart!Finally, the most annoying thing during my stay was the noise from the onslaught of municipal and vendor trucks that seemed to come around every 30 minutes from around 4 am throughout the morning. At first, I thought the sound was from a street sweeping truck. I accepted it and figured it would be gone and then I go back to sleep. But not long after the first bit of truck noise, I heard the loud beeping sound of a truck backing up. I am certain that I heard at least 5 different trucks come through with loud back-up beeping sounds. Perhaps they were vendors unloading supplies for the hotel??? I have no idea but it was very noisy and very early in the morning. Surprisingly, my husband was able to sleep through all the noise. So, maybe, if you're a deep sleeper you might be okay sleeping here. I was not.

Outstanding service and airport location make this hotel a best value for service members. Restaurant is close to McDonald's, and has a good breakfast menu. The hotel is clean and has one of the friendliest and most helpful staff!

This is my second stay here. The first time was great. The convenience of the location here is great. This time is for surgery. The staff is helpful and polite. The rooms are keep up with service every day. I am pleased with my stay.

A plane cancellation caused us to find a place for one night. The city bus recommended the Best Western The Plaza Hotel and delivered us right to the front door. It was between a freeway and the airport. I cannot believe how quiet it was and if we hadn't got on the flight the next day I would have continued my stay at The Plaza Hotel. Thank You for being there.

El Dorado Hills, United States

review_body: Our plane couldn't leave LA for Honolulu due to mechanical problems.They took us all off and found a working aircraft.We didn't arrive till 2 am !!!!!!The Best Western Plaza Hotel shuttle staff picked us up, no problem !!The desk clerk was very friendly and got us a nice high room with a view.The room was very clean and odor-free.I had some important tax papers to work on and mail first thing the next morning.I only got 2 hours sleep and got up early enough to find some stamps, mail the papers,and grab the shuttle back to the airport heading for New Zealand.So I find the stamp machine in the hotel lobby and wouldn't ya know it, they're out of stamps !! I'm panicking because I don't have enough time to get to the post office and risk missing our flight.Mena and Sharon at the front desk came to my rescue !!! After hearing the story and sensing my frustration, Mena offered to take my papers to the post office that afternoon !!!!!! THANK YOU. Usually I'm not a fan of airport hotels but kudos to thestaff and facility.

great value for the money near the airport. had some noise, but that close to the airport and freeway you have to know that it is going to have some. we manly use to sleep and clean up, was great for that.
user_name:
Carl R R
Yelm, United States

review_body: Initially our first room had cockroaches in it and if it were up to me I would have found a different hotel day one. The staff gave us a different room the next morning and it was a much better fit.  There are plusses and minuses to this place, for example the restaurant is only open for dinner four days a week, the room I stayed in only had a tiny microwave and fridge stuffed in a short cupboard which also served as the table for the small flat screen. The shower is very hard to figure out, good water pressure but mostly cold.  The staff is the reason I'm still here even with all the issues. Our housekeeper Mercy is generally very upbeat and welcoming each morning. She created a relaxing environment where our needs are taken care of she seems genuinely interested in making our stay better and that goes a long way.

This hotel is wonderful. The staff is very friendly and so polite. Amalia is my house keeper she is amazing, very attentive to my families needs. She always keeps our rooms looking great. I love that she knows my children's names. Wonderful hotel! We love Amalia!!

This is a really great hotel, especially if you've recently relocated to the area and plan to stay in one for more than a few days. Everyone is very accommodating and friendly. The housekeeping staff do an amazing job and are there if you need anything. The beds are also very comfortable and clean. Bathroom is a little small but also very clean, and the showers have great water pressure. They do have a restaurant downstairs for breakfast and dinner only. Like most hotels, it can be slightly pricey, but the food (especially breakfast) is delicious. They also have a convenience store. It's literally two seconds from the airport and the interstate, and the good news is it's not noisy. As a matter of fact, I've never heard the planes taking off. If you choose this hotel expecting Hilton or Westin type rooms, then you will dissapoint yourself, but if you choose this hotel expecting the highest quality service, comfort, and accommodations, and the friendliest staff, you will not go wrong.

Every other day the restaurant does not serve meals and you must be shuttled to nearby motel. Food was good, but nothing was available until 5 PM. IF you are jet-lagged and need to eat, there is no choice. I hate to pay significantly more money for a facility that does not have an open restaurant.

This hotel is great for the convenience if your working on base. Back of hotel is not great quality, which is where I was put up. Lots of trash, homeless and noisy trucks in the morning. The A/C drowns out the noise a lot though. It worked for me for the convenience, but I'd request at the main hotel next time, it's detached from the rest of the hotel and I didn't feel safe going to do my laundry at night alone.

Noreen D
San Diego, United States

review_body: Close to the airport with GREAT shuttle service. The staff and front desk personnel are excellent, although check in lines frequently are long. Somehow their process is time consuming. The hotel rooms close to the highway are extraordinarily noisy! Make sure you reserve a room away from the highway and facing the airport otherwise you will not get much sleep.This is the third time I have stayed here and it is still the same....needs updating although the rooms are clean and well kept. The windows NEED to be sound proofed!The restaurant is above average with super servers. They are extremely accommodating and always with a smile! The hotel caters to military and their families. It is great to see them and we are thankful for their sacrifice.

I had the opportunity to stay here for 3 weeks for work. The best part about coming back from work? Being asked how my day was by the housekeeping staff, especially Annie. She was very friendly and hospitable. She went above and beyond to ensure that I was getting all that I needed. Overall, this hotel has an awesome staff. It really added to my pleasant stay at Oahu. Highly recommended!

Stayed for 12 days, and found an incredibly helpful staff that made the stay well worth it. Hotel was clean, restaurant and cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. Cecilia, Sharon, Michael, Chandra, just to name a few of the personnel who made for a great family experience.

I lived in this hotel for two months. I will be rating it 5 stars due to all of the employees. I had the same housekeeper, Amalia, for the entire time of our stay.She was amazing because she had to work around my kid's sleep and play schedule, which she did everyday. Also, the few times we needed something fixed the maintanance guys were here within five minutes. The ladies at rhe font desk always called when I had mail. I have watched all of them deal with irate and hateful customers with complete respect.There is a gym with free weights and cardio machines that is kept in pristine condition. The Plaza Cafe was the joy for us nightly. The staff is made up of the friendliest people you could ask for. My family will be coming back to the restaurant to see Sharon, Gemma, Ramone, and James because they are amazing at their job.

This hotel is nice. It is a little on the older side, but is clean and the staff was great. Housekeeping service was outstanding, as was maintenance. When I checked in the fridge and Wi-Fi were not working. Within an hour I had a brand new fridge and working internet.Only downside is the location relative to the interstate. If you are a light sleeper the constant freeway noise might bother you. But for me it was not a bother.

I stayed here for a couple of weekends and while here I had a wonderful stay thanks to, Merey and Grace. These two women did beyond what I expected and couldn't ask for more. Thank You for the stay and the comfort you provided.

Staff and airport location make this a high-potential property. The dated and dingy rooms (especially the bathrooms), make this an overall poor value and disappointing experience. The convenience store and restaurant are not open 24 hours like all airport hotels need to be. They removed the lounge years ago, and never replaced it.
user_name:
Douglas J
Jordan, MN, United States

review_body: Our plane was delayed and we had to stay an extra night ( I know, poor me, stuck in Hawaii for an extra day). Beau at the best western was very kind and understanding of our situation and gave us a very nice room. It was late and she was able to recommend a place to eat that was quite good. Overall, a very decent and quiet place to stay near the airport.

The rooms were in great condition. Very modern hotel. One aspect of my stay that I didn't expect to be as great as it was, was the service I received from my room attendant Annie. At various different times she went out of her way to ensure that my stay was as best as it could be. I will definitely return to this hotel based on her hospitality alone. Amazing attendant.

Each time I make a trip to Honolulu, I always look forward to staying in this hotel because of its cleanliness and most importantly, courteous front desk employee named Beau. She posses outstanding customer service, no matter how terrible my trip was, she found ways to brighten and made my day at ease. Kudos to Beau, and I look forward for another stay in the near future.

I stayed in this hotel for over two weeks as I was PCS'd into Hawaii. This hotel is a great value find. The staff are very friendly and accomodating especially Amalia the maid who took care of our room while we were there.

The staff gave you the feeling that you were family instead of number. The staff always had a smile even after dealing with a hard customer before me. Mercy of the house keeping staff was helpful in keeping condiments and coffee stocked with a very positive attitude.

Easy Access to Military Installations on the Leeward side within the government rate of $177 (as of Jan 2016). A bit of a drive to fun stuff if you're on vacation (I wasn't so didn't care). The older two-story structure is very close to constant noise from Nimitz Hwy. Older, but clean well maintained rooms.

Merey my house keeper does a fantastic room service, is clean well organized. She changes bed sheets daily, removes used towels, restocks the towels organized on towel racks.The coffee pot is cleaned daily, restocks the coffee for next day, leaves a package with cream, sweeteners and coffee stirs. The room is vacuumed daily,trash cans and recycling can emptied daily, new trash can liners installed. I recommend the house keeper and the other staff members.

We had a 6 am flight back to the mainland so it made sense to stay by the airport. Unfortunately there are only two choices, the Ohana or the Plaza both of which are basic hotels.The staff were great and friendly though and while the room was quite basic, it was also clean and offered enough space for our stuff (as a family of 4 with younger kids we have regular luggage plus car seats).There is both a McDonalds as well as a strip mall (starbucks, pizza and a couple of other restaurants) around the corner should you get in late enough you need a bite. We left early so no breakfast for us. The shuttle driver was nice and we had no problems.One the bad side, the hotel is located next to an elevated freeway and the windows aren't soundproof. I'm a deep sleeper so it was quiet enough for me but I could see some being bothered with this.Overall if we needed to stay by the airport we'd definitely return.

Out of All the Best Western Hotels we've stayed This was the BEST of the Best. From the staff to the amenities they make you feel as if it were there just for you. They seriously go out of their way to make you feel your Family.

Quality of hotel very good. I wanted something clean, quiet and these things were offered. Not close to downtown area but loved the convenience of rest/relaxation before return home. I travel a lot, mostly abroad and this was my first experience at a Best Western and I was pleasantly surprised. Not high end but very acceptable for convenience. I didn't eat at the restaurants so I cannot vouch for quality

Ruby H
Santa Fe, United States

review_body: Just renewed my room here with my family. Cherae and Lan at the front desk make everything so easy for me and always check up on us. Makes us feel like we are at home. Rosendo Acob from housekeeping also always tends to our extra needs promptly. Sandra and Mina also from front desk makes our visits pleasurable that's why we always come back. There may be cheaper places to stay at, but we always come back because of the staff

Since we had a flight early in the morning we chose to stay at a hotel near the airport for one night. However, this hotel was way overpriced for the standard it offered. It felt out-dated, and the vending machines were under-stocked.

Our stay here at Best Western has been great so far. The rooms are pretty spacious, free Wi-Fi, microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker. There is a gym and pool in the hotel. I just wish they had a play area for families with little children to play in.  Our room attendant Annie is very friendly and a family oriented person. She made our stay feel like home away from home. The kids and I enjoy her short company. :) We love the walking distance to Mac Donald and other food places, NEX and Hickam are not that far either. Overall Best Western and it's friendly staff has done us good. :)

I have to say that this hotel staff is amazing. The staff that made my family feel at home include Mr. Les, Mrs. Beau, Ms. Lan, and Mr. James. Me and my family have no issues with the hotel and I would definitely stay here every time. The staff here are very professional and have alot of information that the guess can use. To think about it, I don't feel like a guess here at all. Me and my family actually feel like we are with family here. This the best hotel that I have ever stayed in, hands down.

Family of 3 on our way to Kauai and had to stay one night in Honolulu. This hotel had everything we needed - free airport service and restauarnt on site. Beds were comfortable and showers were hot. Hotel is a bit older and bathroom only has room for 1. I would stay here again only for a one nighter and the free airport service.

Denise G
North Pole, AK, United States

review_body: I have used this hotel, Best Western the Plaza for all my business trip over the last 4 years. The staff, especially Rose and Beau, at the Front Desk are simply incredible. They go beyond normal to make sure all your needs are met, not to mention their happy, helpful and fun personalities. Their welcome to everyone if infectious. I look forward to seeing the 2 of them every trip.The location of the hotel to the airport, where I conduct the business end of my trips, is perfect and still very convenient for all other foray out and about. I can't ask for any more except longer stay in Hawaii :)Thanks Rose and Beau.

Many positives of this hotel: near McDonald's, clean rooms (only one cockroach in the sink), helpful management, nice pool area, good restaurant and gift shop on site, within walking distance of several small local restaurants and a Starbucks, near the public bus stop, and reliable airport shuttle. The negatives included: no elevators to all floors, noisy rooms, since it is near a big highway, and limited pool hours. Take bug spray for pool time at dawn or dusk. Also, the restaurant is not open every day, so check at the desk.

I want to recognize Cheral who treated us so nicely when we checked in. After an ordeal at the rental car office, I was not in a good mood. Cheral recognized that and showed tremendous empathy and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.. Later, she gave us excellent recommendations for activities near by and for a great and reasonable seafood restaurant also nearby called Nico's. Go there before 5pm as it gets busy. Parking was attached and is priced according to your Best Western status. Ours cost $15. McDonald's right around the corner. Thank you Cheral!!!

Our room was located on the side closest to the highway, so needless to say it was very noisy. But what made up for it was the service and care from the hotel staff on everything we needed. If you get the chance to stay here, be sure to ask for Cherae at the Front Desk. She provides impeccable service! Very warm and welcoming. She even provided us with $40 in meal coupons for the hotel restaurant after she has made a small error on our paperwork. Would certainly stay again, and you should too!

We spent one night here on our way to Kauai. The service was fine and the Restaurant was good but the room was in serious need of updating. It was also rather loud at times as other guests walked down the hall talking. We didn't get a great nights sleep.

These is a good value if you want to stay near the airport. The room was large, clean, and had good internet. The building is a little old so you will hear people in the neighboring rooms, especially in the bathroom. Also, there can be a significant amount of noise from the lower and elevated highway.

Chose to stay here as we had an early flight. Room was fine for a one-night stay. The bed was kind of small for two. The road noise was a bit loud. Okay for an overnight but probably not an extended stay. The bus driver was exceptionally sweet and helpful.

My stay at Best Western was awesome! My son and I stayed a month and I have no complaints. I really appreciate the hospitality of Lan, Charae and Mena! I hope I spelled their names correctly, however, these ladies were present when I needed help the most and were of great assistance!

We needed one night near the airport as we could not make a same day connection, so we booked the BW Best thing about this hotel is its proximity to the airport (but noise was not an issue for us!) and the free airport shuttle. When we arrived we easily found the hotel phones in the baggage claim area and were promptly picked up and taken to the hotel.Check-in was quick and easy and the room was clean and tidy; what more could you want.We did not try any on-site facilities as we arrived late and left early, but I'm sure the hotel would be sufficient for a few days.All in all, exactly what we wanted at a fair price!

My family of 4 had a restful day at this hotel on our way to NZ. The room was quiet and the beds comfortable. The staff went out of their way to help us on Christmas eve. We were there from 10 pm to 7 pm and allowed to use their fitness room and lobby internet. We stored our luggage and hopped the bus outside the door for a beach day in Waikiki. The shuttle was quick and relaxing. The cheerful welcome was needed and appreciated. Great stop over hotel. We will be back.

Our family pcsed here and the staff is just awesome. Amalia is our cleaning lady on our floor and I just love her. She interacts with my 3 kids they just adore her. she also makes sure that we have everything that we need. she makes staying here worth it as well as the rest of the staff here. you don't normally fid a staff that knows your name cause most people dont care to know but Amalia knows all of our names and I think thats a plus. I recommend anyone to stay here and if you want just some one who you can talk to and makes sure that you are comfortable and the sweetest person that you will meet I say try to get Amalia's floor. I cant say enough about her, but all the staff here are so nice and sweet they are always happy. Mahalo!
